author: NonStampCollector

text: This is one of the greatest stories in the Bible. Not only does the Bible tell it but most other cultures have their own account of the Great Flood. Europe: >Greek: Zeus sent a flood to destroy the men of the Bronze Age. Prometheus advised his son Deucalion to build a chest. All other men perished except for a few who escaped to high mountains. The mountains in Thessaly were parted, and all the world beyond the Isthmus and Peloponnese was overwhelmed. Deucalion and his wife Pyrrha (daughter of Epimetheus and Pandora), after floating in the chest for nine days and nights, landed on Parnassus. >Roman: Jupiter, angered at the evil ways of humanity, resolved to destroy it. He was about to set the earth to burning, but considered that that might set heaven itself afire, so he decided to flood the earth instead. >Scandinavian: Oden, Vili, and Ve fought and slew the great ice giant Ymir, and icy water from his wounds drowned most of the Rime Giants. The giant Bergelmir escaped, with his wife and children, on a boat made from a hollowed tree trunk. From them rose the race of frost ogres. Ymir's body became the world we live on. His blood became the oceans. >Celtic: Heaven and Earth were great giants, and Heaven lay upon the Earth so that their children were crowded between them, and the children and their mother were unhappy in the darkness. The boldest of the sons led his brothers in cutting up Heaven into many pieces. From his skull they made the firmament. His spilling blood caused a great flood which killed all humans except a single pair, who were saved in a ship made by a beneficent Titan. The waters settled in hollows to become the oceans. >Welsh: The lake of Llion burst, flooding all lands. Dwyfan and Dwyfach escaped in a mastless ship with pairs of every sort of living creature. They landed in Prydain (Britain) and repopulated the world. Middle East: >Sumerian: The gods had decided to destroy mankind. The god Enlil warned the priest-king Ziusudra ("Long of Life") of the coming flood by speaking to a wall while Ziusudra listened at the side. He was instructed to build a great ship and carry beasts and birds upon it. Violent winds came, and a flood of rain covered the earth for seven days and nights. >Persian: In early times, the earth was full of malign creatures fashioned by the evil Ahriman. The angel Tistar (the star Sirius) descended three times, in the form of man, horse, and bull respectively, causing ten days and nights of rain each time. Each rain drop became as big as a bowl, and the water rose the height of a man over the whole earth. South/North America: >Norton Sound Eskimo: In the first days, the water from the sea came up and flooded all the earth except for a very high mountain in the middle. A few animals escaped to this mountain, and a few people survived in a boat, subsisting on fish. The people landed on the mountain as the water subsided and followed the retreating water to the coast. The animals also descended. >Greenlander: The world once overturned. Some people were turned into fiery spirits; all the rest drowned but one. Afterwards, the survivor smote the ground with his stick, a woman sprung out, and the two of them repopulated the world. Proof of the flood is found in the form of sea fossils on high mountains. >Cherokee (Great Lakes area; eastern Tennessee): Day after day, a dog stood at the river bank and howled piteously. Rebuked by his master, the dog said a flood was coming, and he must build and provision a boat. Furthermore, the dog said, he must throw him, the dog, into the water. For a sign that he spoke the truth, the dog showed the back of his neck, which was raw and bare with flesh and bone showing. The man followed directions, and he and his family survived; from them, the present population is descended. >Toltec (Mexico): One of the Tezcatlipocas (sons of the original dual god) transformed himself into the Sun and created the first humans to show up his brothers. The other gods, angry at his audacity, had Quetzalcoatl destroy the sun and the earth, which he did with a flood. >Inca (Peru): Pictorial records of ancient Incan rulers show that a flood rose above the highest mountains. All created things perished, except for a man and woman who floated in a box. >Eastern Brazil (Rio de Janiero region): Two twin sons of a great wizard, one good and the other evil, were always arguing. One day the angered good brother stamped so hard that the earth opened and water gushed out, shooting as high as the clouds. The water covered the whole world.  Sorry the post is so long. I'm fascinated by this topic. There are many stories like these from everywhere on Earth and I only shared a fraction of them. A little too many to be coincidence.

text: If a story is religious it instantly looses it’s merit with certain people. As someone who enjoys reading and studying literature, I’d rather judge a story by how well written it is and how it makes me feel rather than  prematurely judge it before even reading it (or in this case watching it). Don’t you know there are many things you can relate to in a story, even if it is in fact religious? If you truly do not like religious lit/themes, then look past it and you’ll find something nicer, like a good story. This also goes for those hardcore religious-heads who won’t read anything but religious lit.   I understand this probably isn’t as easy as it seems to me.

text: Looks like a great movie--I'm actually excited about this movie. For people who fight the notion/argument that God doesn't exist based on lack of evidence, that is not a valid argument. Even Atheists such as Richard Dawkins (considered a father of Atheism) rejects this idea and does not build his argument around it because even he understands that: The absence of evidence is not the evidence of absence. Also for those who argue that the definition of faith means to "walk blindly" is also incorrect. Contrary to popular belief, faith is not a reduction to fideism--which means we believe only from what we are told--that is a silly argument to defend and even Christians should reject this idea. Faith is NOT the belief without proof, rather it maintains a complete trust and confidence of something or someone. That sincere trust and faith in God is represented over a period of time based on extraordinary testimony and presence of Him being faithful to us. Christianity, as many of you know, is a faith-based religion. Faith in the Trinity (such as the Father, Son and Holy Spirit) and the Bible is a historical and parable book that guides Christians and asks people to trust in God.  Similarily, Atheists trust/have faith in Science. Science does not have all or produce all the answers. Just because Science cannot cure the common cold, should we reject that Science cannot help us? No. That would not be a fair argument. But as we have faith in the natural order, we should also consider the possibility of a supernatural one. There are multitudes of testimony from Atheists, Buddhists, Muslims, Satanists, etc. that have had experienced Jesus Christ and have converted--even though their entire lives were to preach against this message. I highly encourage people to look at fellow testimonies because it is backs evidence of the Bible.  Cheers!

text: The thing is, everyone on here who is violently against religion, I think is really only against our modern day interpretation of it. Humans have only been around for a couple thousand years, yet the universe is billions of years old. It's easy to imagine that another race of intelligence lived and evolved on another planet before earth was ever made. Whether or not they planted life is irrelevant, the point is that they might be so advanced that they've shed their bodies and become pure consciousness.... This doesn't have to be a story about magic that breaks the laws of science. This could be about a greater and older intelligence that can interact with us through a collective consciousness that we don't understand. I've never been a religious person, but it's not hard to imagine how this could actually happen through the scenario I've described.

text: It simply amazes me that the defense of Atheism is based on opinions rather than facts. (I gathered this based off of current debates below) Most Atheists argue and yet are limited in both their knowledge about Science and the Bible itself. These two are not a contradiction to each other, contrary to popular belief. Most Atheists don't understand the true definition of faith, so how can we have a debate if you have no concept of what faith actually means? If faith were indeed a reduction to Fideism than even Atheists would have to reject Science because they have faith in it.  It is unfortunate to see how Atheists do not have a good foundation even with their own faith--which is Science. The whole argument of "God is not physically present therefore He cannot exist" is BS and hypocritical. Your faith implores that you measure, understand and study things that are not physically present either--such as space, time and gravity. The laws of Thermodynamics (Second Law specifically) actually contradicts the Big Bang Theory, because if this actually happened (which it still is possible) the energy to create this universe had to have come from somewhere. Atheists please remember that the very Science that you so fiercely defend actually was constructed by smart, respected religious individuals--and while you maintain that many in time denied the existence of God (or rejected the notion of Him) many still have not.

text: I don't think it's good for people to be writing such negative things here. Either way it's just a movie... If you would like to argue with someone about it then fine, that's your choice, but just know that by doing that you will not accomplish anything at all, either for yourself or the other person. Yes, people have their own opinions but haven't any of you heard that "If you don't have anything nice to say, don't say anything at all?". Will it make any of you feel better by writing an essay of your beliefs, opinions, etc? Why can't you understand? It is these types of things that lead the people in this story/movie to be wiped out in the first place. Ignorance, hate, being rude, etc. I am not saying that this story is true or not because  I don't want to cause another 'fight' here in the comment section..but seriously? Most people here are acting like children. Are we really so immature that we need to resort to this? - I am 13 years old by the way-that would explain my username (back when I was in 7th grade lol).Anyways, I hope I get my point across to some of you. Thanks.

The only ones who are morons are the ones who are saying the rest of the world should believe what they do. Whether they are religious or not. Nobody has the place to say. And PS, this movie has taken the God out of the movie I'm pretty sure. It's more about the struggle of Noah and his family with everyone else. They strayed from the story of the Bible, which I don't really agree with. But I love those actors, and I think it looks like a good movie so I'm seeing it. The hate here is so unnecessary and juvenile. Grow up.

text: Back in 2004, i was a true atheist, i would put Margret O'Hare to shame,I thought religion was garbage and religious people were a crock, Then I saw The Passion of The Christ knowing that it was going to christian dogma. Two hours later I left the theater crying and changed,never had a movie touched me so much,now I am a pastor and I talk to atheists who want to come back to faith. That film inspired not only me, but there was a murder who killed someone 40 years ago, the movie touched him he went and confessed to the crime. Biblical films have ways of touching people, this film seems that it may do the same thing, I read that the director has a message in this film that is not shown until the that sums up everything the story of Noah is about, it is quiet surprising i guess. Biblical films are becoming popular again, with Greg Kinnear in Heaven is for Real and Christian Bale as Moses in Ridley Scotts Exodus, I think there is more interest in these stories than ever before.

text: So... the true story is...  Noah had 3 sons. The names dont come to my mind now. He had 8 people in his family. And... then (sorry I gotta skip stuff I forgot some) some angels came down and they became like men, marrying the women. (or something) And then the women had babies, who grew up to be big bullies, called the Nephilem. they beat up everyone. Even the kids! The earth was filled with violence. This hurt Jehovah god. So he decided: I will send a huge storm, It will rain and rain for 40 days and 40 nights. But what about the birds and the animals? How will Noah and his family survive? Jehovah gave Noah special instructions to build a life-saving ark. They worked hard to build it. Jehovah told Noah to warn everyone. The non-believers probably said: You fools! Why are you building this huge box here? Your wasting your time! Our world is never going to end. But noah listened to god, and kept building. When the ark was done, Jehovah told Noah and his family: I will unleash the flood in just 7 days. So Noah took 8 elephants into the ark, and 2 of every other one. When they got inside, Jehovah closed the door. Now Noah and family had to wait. (1 raindrop) (a few) Boom! the heavens burst open, it rained and it rained for 40 days and 40 nights. To be continued...

text: Qur'an Chapter 71 - Soorah Nooh - ((Prophet) Noah)   In the Name of Allâh, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful    [071:001] Verily, We sent Nûh (Noah) to his people (saying): "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful torment."   [071:002] He said: "O my people! Verily, I am a plain warner to you,   [071:003] "That you should worship Allâh (Alone), fear (be dutiful to) Him, and obey me,   [071:004] "He (Allâh) will forgive you of your sins and respite you to an appointed term. Verily, the term of Allâh when it comes, cannot be delayed, if you but know."   [071:005] He said: "O my Lord! Verily, I have called to my people night and day (i.e. secretly and openly to accept the doctrine of Islâmic Monotheism),   [071:006] "But all my calling added nothing but to (their) flight (from the truth).   [071:007] "And verily, every time I called to them that You might forgive them, they thrust their fingers into their ears, covered themselves up with their garments, and persisted (in their refusal), and magnified themselves in pride.   [071:008] "Then verily, I called to them openly (aloud).   [071:009] "Then verily, I proclaimed to them in public, and I have appealed to them in private.   [071:010] "I said (to them): 'Ask forgiveness from your Lord, verily, He is Oft-Forgiving;   [071:011] 'He will send rain to you in abundance,   [071:012] 'And give you increase in wealth and children, and bestow on you gardens and bestow on you rivers.' "   [071:013] What is the matter with you, that [you fear not Allâh (His punishment), and] you hope not for reward (from Allâh or you believe not in His Oneness).   [071:014] While He has created you in (different) stages [i.e. first Nutfah, then 'Alaqah and then Mudghah, see (V.23:13,14)].   [071:015] See you not how Allâh has created the seven heavens one above another?   [071:016] And has made the moon a light therein, and made the sun a lamp?   [071:017] And Allâh has brought you forth from the (dust of) earth. (Tafsir At-Tabarî)   [071:018] Afterwards He will return you into it (the earth), and bring you forth (again on the Day of Resurrection).   [071:019] And Allâh has made for you the earth a wide expanse.   [071:020] That you may go about therein in broad roads.   [071:021] Nûh (Noah) said: "My Lord! They have disobeyed me, and followed one whose wealth and children give him no increase but loss.   [071:022] "And they have plotted a mighty plot.   [071:023] "And they have said: 'You shall not leave your gods, nor shall you leave Wadd, nor Suwâ', nor Yaghûth, nor Ya'ûq, nor Nasr' (these are the names of their idols).   [071:024] "And indeed they have led many astray. And (O Allâh): 'Grant no increase to the Zâlimûn (polytheists, wrong doers, and disbelievers) except error.' "   [071:025] Because of their sins they were drowned, then were made to enter the Fire. And they found none to help them instead of Allâh.   [071:026] And Nûh (Noah) said: "My Lord! Leave not one of the disbelievers on the earth!   [071:027] "If You leave them, they will mislead Your slaves, and they will beget none but wicked disbelievers.   [071:028] "My Lord! Forgive me, and my parents, and him who enters my home as a believer, and all the believing men and women. And to the Zâlimûn (polytheists, wrong doers, and disbelievers) grant You no increase but destruction!"

text: I can't believe how many stupid comments that have been written about this trailer.  If you don't believe the Biblical account, or prescribe to Biblical values, go wallow in your filth elsewhere.  Your ridiculous, mindless banter isn't welcome here.  Go ahead and believe in the "modern" humanistic version of science being propagated today.  It takes a lot of faith (more than to believe in Christianity I might add) to believe that everything that exists came from absolutely nothing(!!), then magically appeared and began to revolve on its axis confined to the size of a period on a page (point of singularity), then eventually got so hot and exploded, making everything you see today by way of a "big bang".  Oh, and then you have to master such great odds that you basically win the lottery millions of times in a row to achieve life in the simplest forms (e.g. amino acids), which of course must graduate (presumably after eons and eons) to become complex (and even conscious) organisms (never mind the irreducibly complex organs which must be compiled to make the organism).  Then again, I suppose there is no faith or belief involved here at all, just mindless following...  A person who wants to believe that humanity is the highest order of creation will do just about anything to justify his/her position.  Of course, there is no absolute authority or judge if that is true.  To ponder; If you don't believe in absolutes, are you absolutely sure?  God loves you and will take you into His family (Romans 10:8-10)

text: The Earth has been populated in stages, which means that one lifeform was annhilated before another took over. So in the case of humans--the first homonoid forms have no relationship to the modern man, Adam, from whom we have decended. And it was left to Noah to preserve modern man and the animals of the region. So the flood was not a global occurence, but to the man of that time, it effectively was, while animals and perhaps some human forms on distant continents were hardly affected. As a Christian and a scientist, this makes more sense to me.

text: What is really fascinating is that the oldest genealogies worldwide show memories of the great flood.  every continent except Antarctica, from antiquity, has stories of it.  And some of the better kept genealogies, such as the Vikings, and Irish, who kept scrupulous, meticulous genealogy records, record Wodin being descended from Japheth, son of Noah. These were NOT Christians, but violent war like pagans.  Who took their genealogy VERY seriously.   Quite  a few other societies in western Europe claim Japheth as well, albeit in some cases his name has degenerated a bit, kind of like in the game telephone.  In other parts of the world, records go back to showing their lines being descended from Shem, son of Noah, and so on with Ham.....

text: It's so funny - the comments about this movie.  Why the vehement remarks about how "unbelievable", "ridiculous", "impossible", and "fairytale-ish" this movie is?  No one has that kind of reaction when Batman, Superman, Lord of the Rings, X-men, etc have been released.  The fact that people react so violently shows that there is just something about God, Jesus, and the Bible that strike a cord in folks.  Let's not pretend this is a "christian" movie, though.  Obviously, if a film was made 100% true to the Biblical record of the flood, the world would not be able to relate, nor would they enjoy it.  You think anyone wants to hear how evil they are and that God had a right to destroy them?  No way.  I'm sure Hollywood found a way to make this important story while removing the importance of God's holiness and right to judge.  Russ Crowe is awesome though, and even though I am a true Christian, I will enjoy this "escapism", nonetheless.  Cinematic beauty!

author: Charles W.

text: There is one major flaw in this film already. And that is the portrayal of the Antediluvian human race being some pre-industrial, rudimentary-tool-using, medieval-type population! In a nutshell, any film or documentary about the period of time prior to the Great Flood, should portray them technologically very similar, if not superior to us today in 2014! There is more than ample evidence and facts to support the growing theory that ancient man was not some dumb, bumbling, knuckle-dragging, wife-clubbing, unga-bunga-ing race that didn't know what was over the next hill! On the contrary! The Bible speaks and hints of man's intelligence not to far from Adam and Eve, such as Jubal and Tubal-Cain (Note: Tubal-Cain's name even survived the Flood and changed as languages changed after Babel. Tubal-Cain eventually became Bal-Cain, then Bal-Can, Bulcan or Bulkan/Bilkan to Vulcan, the Roman god of fire, including volcanoes, usually depicted as a metalsmith with a hammer. Tubal-Cain was the original father of metallurgy, read in Genesis). Antediluvian people, individually lived an average of 700 to 1,000 years each, and all spoke a single language, some form of what we would today call Semitic. This, coupled with them most likely having a percentage of brain usage near 100%, and being far superior to us today not only mentally, but physically and genetically as well, there is no reason why they would not have rapidly developed technology equal to our own today, or better! And I don't mean ancient alien intervention either! No need for it! Adam and Eve would have been perfect and could speak from the start, so they also no doubt could read and write too, and most likely knew how Earth, the solar system, atmosphere, and outer space worked among many other things. They may have possessed telekinesis snd telepathy as well! It was their charge to pass on all of their God given knowledge to their offspring! By the time of Noah, several billion people would have been on Earth, possibly similar to our population today! My whole point is this, Biblically speaking, which is what I believe and what makes most scientific sense as well, to portray Preflood humanity as preindustrial flatearthers is jot only ridiculous, but also unscientific, unbiblical, and unwarranted!
author: W Gaston

text: I get the impression that Noah is also portrayed as being a drunkard, which the Bible does not say he is! He became drunk after the Flood, but it says nothing of this prior. Perhaps the thinning of the atmosphere, loss of the vaporsphere layer that rained out, allowing extreme sun rays to penetrate to Earth for the first time, unexpectedly made the wine much stronger in alcohol unbeknownst to Noah at first. I don't know, but it must be considered. Another thing. Will they be showing dinosaurs and other "prehistoric" animals going on the ark? I highly doubt it! I didn't see any in the trailer which doesn't surprise me! At any rate. I won't insult my intelligence by going to see some bastardized biblical movie that will no doubt piss me off with it's sad and perverted portrayal! I will go see SON OF GOD, but not NOAH!

text: Perhaps. Noah was human afterall and I'm sure that being only one of eight survivors out of the billions that perished in the Flood, would no doubt take it's toll on him, but, we must also remember that Noah had his family, and God was with him, especially due to the circumstances! He may have suffered PTSD, but again, we cannot extrapolate back and assume because many suffer PTSD today, that Noah must have as well. The Bible says God was with Noah and in such a literal planetary-wide upheaval, Noah would need extra encouragement. But, him still being human, we can ignore the possibility of PTSD even if only on a minimal level.

Wisdom of Solomon Chapter 11:17-19  "17 For thy Almighty hand, that made the world of matter without form, wanted not means to send among them a multitude of bears or fierce lions, 18 Or unknown wild beasts, full of rage, newly created, breathing out either a fiery vapour, or filthy scents of scattered smoke, or shooting horrible sparkles out of their eyes: 19 Whereof not only the harm might dispatch them at once, but also the terrible sight utterly destroy them."  It says made the "world of matter without form", its basically saying made matter from nothing. text: Radio Carbon, Uranium-Lead, Potassium-Argon, etc., are not as reliable we are lead to believe. A fossil can be dated by all three methods and come up with three totally different dates. Also, using the same method multiple times can give extremely variant ages. Dinosaur fossils have been dated from a few hundred, to a few thousand, to millions of years old. Brand new solidified rock from Mount Saint Helens volcanic eruption in 1980 was dated to, I think, 350 thousand years old, and it was brand new rock! Well, nothing on Earth is brand new, but there are "reset buttons" and newly solidified lava rock among them.

author: W Gaston

text: How did only two people initially start the human race at Creation, and subsequently how did only eight people restart the human race after the Flood?  Adam and Eve were directly created by God which means they were humanly perfect. They had not yet sinned bringing down a curse upon all creation. Their DNA was flawless. They had no genetic load. Now, along with being perfect, they were also given the power and freedom of choice. God did not desire to make robots who only behaved and lived according to preprogramming. When put to the test, they chose to disobey God. This test was intentional and it gives man the choice to choose or reject God. This act brought sin, death, and imperfection into the world. However,  in spite of all of this, Adam lived to be 930 years old! Evolutionists and Creationists pretty much agree that the whole planet was once much warmer than today with a much richer and thicker atmosphere with much more carbon dioxide and oxygen than today. The difference is when. Biblically, this lush, subtropical, pleasant Earth existed prior to the Flood, when most of the surface water was locked into a subcrustal interconnected aquafer known as the hydroplate. The rest was diffused throughout the middle to upper atmosphere in a layer called a vaporsphere. This meant the Antediluvian (Pre-flood) world was very different than today. Instead of Earth's surface being 70% water to 30% land, it was just the opposite, 30% water to 70% land. At any rate, suffice to say, much thicker atmosphere than today. This, coupled with Adam and Eve being genetically, mentally, and physically perfect would have allowed for people to be much more verile and superior. Even after they fell from grace, their superiority didn't immediately come crashing down to our level today. For the whole Preflood era which lasted around 2,000 years, mankind had an average longevity of around 800 plus years. Adam and Eve had two sons, Cain and Able. Cain murdered Able out of jealosy. Cain was banished and moved east and it says he built a city and had a son, Enoch. Where did Cain get a wife? We must remember that around two millennia are covered in just a few chapters of Genesis. A lot of condensing and time lapsing is going on here. The Bible says Adam and Eve had another son, Seth. It goes on to say that Adam and Eve went on to have other sons and daughters, none mentioned by name. Living to be 930, I'm sure he could have fathered a small army! Cain married either a sister or cousin. Remember, at the beginnings, and apparently for the whole Preflood era, the gene pool remained pure, or extremely close to it. Then, after the Flood destroyed everything and killed all of the billions of people with only eight surviving - Noah and his wife and their three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth and their wives, it was a very similar scenario. They took with them their Preflood verility, superiority, and near perfect genetics. So again, brothers, sisters, cousins, nieces, and nephews marrying and having children posed no threat. But, changes had taken place during the flood that greatly thinned the atmosphere and removed the vaporsphere. This allowed for the first time, harmful cosmic and solar rays to penetrate to Earth's surface. As the generations passed after the Flood, you can read in the genealogies that longevity started to drop over time until it leveled off at around a 120 year average. Then over much more time eventually dropped down to around a 70 year longevity average. Today, we have an accumulated genetic load, mistakes and mutations in the DNA, that have built up. This can cause very close familial relations to have problems with their offspring such as retardation, deformation, or any other harmful birth defect. Even with a brother-sister copulation resulting in pregnancy, it must be noted, that with all of the genetic anomalies we have, there is still only a 50/50 chance of birth defects. Not good odds, but not what one would expect. This was a bit longwinded, but I hope it helped answer your question.
author: W Gaston

text: Back to the dinosaurs. Which dinosaurs were on the ark? Two of every kind. But, perhaps it would be sort of like dogs today. All the different dog breeds all descend back to wolves. It is possible that wolves, jackals, foxes, and coyotes all descend back to two base dog kinds on the ark. This same or similar scenario applies to other animals as well, which would include dinosaurs. There may have been different "breeds" of T-Rexes, Stegosaurs, Apatosaurs, etc., but all descending back to two originals. This would greatly reduce the animals on the ark. As for size problems. Take babies! That's a no-brainer! The largest dinosaur still had relatively small eggs and babies.  How did they go extinct? The fossil record is a result of those that perished and were quickly buried by the Flood. They did make a comeback after the Flood, but people, hunted them for sport, or because they feared a huge animal living close to home. So, these animals, especially the more dangerous ones such as the carnivores, were overhunted until they only existed in the most isolated and remote parts of Earth and even then constantly tetered on the brink of extinction. As with any animals, some more than others, when human population increases, animals decrease. Before the Flood, it wasn't as big a problem. The uniform warm climate, vegetation, and much-larger-than-Pangaea- super continent provided a much broader ecosystem to house these large animals. Antediluvia was better suited to life! Postdiluvia was riddled with opposing ecosystems, extreme hot and cold, wet and dry, rugged mountains, deep valleys, violent weather conditions, and smaller land areas. Dinosaurs and many other animals had a more difficult time, but were making it. People, over time, pushed them over the edge! There are oodles and oodles of dragon legends, depictions, drawings, and carvings, and they all pretty much are easily recognizable by even a child who knows their dinosaurs. The term "dragon" is merely the older word used for "dinosaur" since the latter term wasn't coined until the late 1800s. Thus dragon = dinosaur.  Even in the modern times, it's not certain they're all extinct. Nessie, Champ, Ogopogo, which are allegedly some type of plesiosaur. Mokele Mbembe is said to be an apatosaurus or similar dinosaur. There have been numerous reports of pterosaurs as well. The frauds, hoaxes, fakes, whiskey-goggles, and mistaken identities do exist, but all of them?! Not hardly! There have been way too many separate and independent reports over the past several centuries up until the modern times.
author: W Gaston

text: How do you know there have never been a dinosaur fossil found that has a man-made wound oj it? You don't know this to be so! I've never done any research on this, so I cannot say for certain than no such wound mark has never been found. I do know that it is very difficult to tell a man-made wound from somethibg else. Other than that, I do not know for sure and neither do you. But, I can say this. I will definitely do some research on this and find out some answers. But, I don't need man-inflicted wounds to know that dinosaurs and man coexisted. Again, the dinosaur and human footprints in the Paluxy River bed in Texas is irrefutable proof positive that man and dinosaurs coexisted. Different sources can claim what they want about the site, but one of the reasons it's a popular tourist site is because of this very fact - human and dinosaur tracks in the same layer of rock. Like I stated earlier, several tests were done that confirmed their authenticity. These tracks were put Book of Enigmas, Anolamies, or OOPARTS, along with hundreds of other things also because of their authenticity. Science has proven their reality, but it flies in the face of evolutionary thought, so, secular scientists don't know what to do with these anomalies, so they're conveniently discarded to a vast list of "x-filed" artefacts. Fossil wounds or not, dinosaurs and humans did live together. That's not my Christian opinion, but a scientific and historic fact! And there are many more similar examples of this fact other than the Paluxy River.

text: It's not merely my Christian opinion. If you want an opinion, here's one. Papa John's Pizza is better than Hungry Howies Pizza. There's an opinion for you. There are more than plenty of historical evidence and factual fossil evidence outside and independent of Christianity that holds it's own in the boxing ring of verification that humans and dinosaurs coexisted. Sediment layers as well as animals, during the Flood, were deposited according to similar consistancy and density. The bottom layers are not older, just denser. And there are many areas on Earth where the geologic column is totally different.  And one shred of evidence is all it sometimes takes to tie a murderer to his victim. Sometimes, depending on the bouncing ball, one fact alone can prove something true or false. Again, I bring forth Dinosaur Valley State Park on the Paluxy River in Texas where a flash flood in 1908 tore up a portion of the rock bottom exposing another layer with several dinosaur specie's footprints all over the place right along with human footprints IN THE SAME EXACT LAYER OF ROCK! Skeptics claimed it was fake. So, excavators dug up the surrounding rock layer and exposed many more of the same footprints. Some even overlapped each other. Still not good enough for the naysayers. So, some of the footprint-containing rocks were cut verifying that the striation sediment lines were pressed in and not carved, when it was soft mud. This is irrefutable facts that prove their coexistence and it would hold up in any sane, common sense court of law!  And what about the fossil shoe or boot print, complete with raised heel showing that when the print was made, the human who made it had stepped on a trilobite!  These are not opinions, but facts! If you could take these separate examples to some group of unbiased people somewhere on Earth that had never heard of evolution or creation, millions or billions of years, or anything similar, selected them for jury duty, and just presented them with all of the facts and evidence, they would conclude that whatever made those animal prints lived with the people that made their prints. Same goes for human and trilobite being contemporaries.  I can't speak for everybody, but if it came down to it, I'd much rather put my stock in some tangible, visible, concrete evidence that's staring me in the face, as opposed to some abstract dating methods that depend on other variables, or in dating rocks by fossils and fossils by rocks, or some other such circular reasoning and non sequiturs.  As for the birds-from-dinosaurs poppycock, well, need I say more!  And just so y'all know. I used to believe in evolution to a point, many years ago, that is, until I started really studying into all of it. So, there's nothing anybody can tell me that have not heard before or that I did no somewhat believe.

text: The Qu'ran (the hole book for all mankind) states that Noah was inspired by God, like other Islamic prophets such as Ibrāhīm (Abraham), Ismā'īl (Ishmael), Ishaq (Isaac), Ya'qub (Jacob), Isa (Jesus), Ilyas‘ (Elijah), Ayub (Job), Harun (Aaron), Yunus (Jonah), Daud (David) and Muhammad (Mohammed), and that he was a faithful messenger. Noah had firm belief in the oneness of God, and preached Islam (literally "submission," meaning submission to God) He continuously warned the people of the painful doom that was coming and asked them to accept one God instead of worshipping idols such as Wadd, Suwa', Yaghuth, Ya'uq and Nasr (Idols were worshiped that time) He called the people to serve God, and said that nobody but God could save them. He said that the time of the deluge was appointed and could not be delayed, and that the people had to submit to God. God commanded Noah to build a ship, the Ark, and as he was building it, the chieftains passed him and mocked him. Upon its completion, the ship is said to be loaded with pairs of every animal available that time, and Noah's household, and 76 believers who did submit to God. The people who denied the message of Noah, including one of his own sons, drowned.[28] The final resting place of the ship was referred to as Mount Judi.[29] Noah is called a grateful servant.[20] Both Noah and Abraham were taught the prophethood and the scripture

text: True, this movie isn't following the Bible 100%. But it's Darren Aronofsky's interpretation into a film. I daresay this film was never meant to interpret the Bible 100% all the way, but merely as a way show to the world the power and glory of God. In the Bible, Noah was indeed mocked and ridiculed by men. Maybe there was never an armed uprising against him led by a king. But in the end, this movie is a FILM ADAPTATION. If it were 100% according to the Bible it wouldn't be as entertaining for the viewers. So people who are complaining about the director "never actually reading the bible", calm down lol. I love God as much as you do, and i'm excited for this movie adaption of one of the most epic acts of God in the Bible!

text: 1.  God provides the best explanation of the origin of the universe.  Given the scientific evidence we have about our universe and its origins, and bolstered by arguments presented by philosophers for centuries, it is highly probable that the universe had an absolute beginning. Since the universe, like everything else, could not have merely popped into being without a cause, there must exist a transcendent reality beyond time and space that brought the universe into existence. This entity must therefore be enormously powerful. Only a transcendent, unembodied mind suitably fits that description.  2.  God provides the best explanation for the fine-tuning of the universe. Contemporary physics has established that the universe is fine-tuned for the existence of intelligent, interactive life.  That is to say, in order for intelligent, interactive life to exist, the fundamental constants and quantities of nature must fall into an incomprehensibly narrow life-permitting range.  There are three competing explanations of this remarkable fine-tuning: physical necessity, chance, or design. The first two are highly implausible, given the independence of the fundamental constants and quantities from nature's laws and the desperate maneuvers needed to save the hypothesis of chance. That leaves design as the best explanation.  3.  God provides the best explanation of objective moral values and duties. Even atheists recognize that some things, for example, the Holocaust, are objectively evil. But if atheism is true, what basis is there for the objectivity of the moral values we affirm? Evolution? Social conditioning? These factors may at best produce in us the subjective feeling that there are objective moral values and duties, but they do nothing to provide a basis for them. If human evolution had taken a different path, a very different set of moral feelings might have evolved. By contrast, God Himself serves as the paradigm of goodness, and His commandments constitute our moral duties. Thus, theism provides a better explanation of objective moral values and duties.   4.  God provides the best explanation of the historical facts concerning Jesus’ life, death, and resurrection.  Historians have reached something of consensus that the historical Jesus thought that in himself God’s Kingdom had broken into human history, and he carried out a ministry of miracle-working and exorcisms as evidence of that fact.  Moreover, most historical scholars agree that after his crucifixion Jesus’ tomb was discovered empty by a group of female disciples, that various individuals and groups saw appearances of Jesus alive after his death, and that the original disciples suddenly and sincerely came to believe in Jesus’ resurrection despite their every predisposition to the contrary. I can think of no better explanation of these facts than the one the original disciples gave:  God raised Jesus from the dead.  5.  God can be personally known and experienced.  The proof of the pudding is in the tasting. Down through history Christians have found through Jesus a personal acquaintance with God that has transformed their lives.   The good thing is that atheists tend to be very passionate people and want to believe in something. If they would only put aside the slogans for a moment and reexamine their worldview in light of the best philosophical, scientific, and historical evidence we have today, then they, too, would find Christmas worth celebrating!

text: *The holy Qur´an about Noah:*  "And recite to them the news of Noah, when he said to his people, "O my people, if my residence and my reminding of the signs of Allah has become burdensome upon you - then I have relied upon Allah . So resolve upon your plan and [call upon] your associates. Then let not your plan be obscure to you. Then carry it out upon me and do not give me respite. And if you turn away [from my advice] then no payment have I asked of you. My reward is only from Allah , and I have been commanded to be of the Muslims."And they denied him, so We saved him and those with him in the ship and made them successors, and We drowned those who denied Our signs. Then see how was the end of those who were warned.Then We sent after him messengers to their peoples, and they came to them with clear proofs. But they were not to believe in that which they had denied before. Thus We seal over the hearts of the transgressors." 10:71-74  "Because of their sins they were drowned and put into the Fire, and they found not for themselves besides Allah [any] helpers. And Noah said, "My Lord, do not leave upon the earth from among the disbelievers an inhabitant. Indeed, if You leave them, they will mislead Your servants and not beget except [every] wicked one and [confirmed] disbeliever. My Lord, forgive me and my parents and whoever enters my house a believer and the believing men and believing women. And do not increase the wrongdoers except in destruction." 71:25-28  "And We have already sent Noah and Abraham and placed in their descendants prophethood and scripture; and among them is he who is guided, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.Then We sent following their footsteps Our messengers and followed [them] with Jesus, the son of Mary, and gave him the Gospel. And We placed in the hearts of those who followed him compassion and mercy and monasticism, which they innovated; We did not prescribe it for them except [that they did so] seeking the approval of Allah . But they did not observe it with due observance. So We gave the ones who believed among them their reward, but many of them are defiantly disobedient. 57:26-27  "And We gave to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob - all [of them] We guided. And Noah, We guided before; and among his descendants, David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus do We reward the doers of good." 6:84 "Indeed, We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], as We revealed to Noah and the prophets after him. And we revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, the Descendants, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon, and to David We gave the book [of Psalms]." 4:163  "Those were the ones upon whom Allah bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell in prostration and weeping." 19:58-59  "He has ordained for you of religion what He enjoined upon Noah and that which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus - to establish the religion and not be divided therein. Difficult for those who associate others with Allah is that to which you invite them. text: Hi. A few questions:  1. Which of noah's family served as the host for the malaria parasite, tapeworms, human liver fluke and brain nematodes?  2. Were cute furry animals drowned by God?  3. Were any children, pregnant women and unborn babies drowned by god too? Why?  4. I'm guessing no asians blacks, or other races on the boat? They "evolved" in the space of 4 thousand years? That's only 100-200 generations.  5. After disembarking, what did lions and tigers eat? One meal of say, a zebra,  means the extinction of an entire species.  6. There are over 12,000 species of ants - they can't interbreed (bring forth) and are genetically less related than humans are to chimpanzees. Did noah have a pair of all 12000 of these?  7. Where were bacteria and viruses like TB and smallpox? Or were these the work of the devil - god only made the cute animals?  8. If you were a deity would you do that too,  or could you think of smarter ways to improve on mistakes you made in your own creation?    Pardon my ignorance - I've read jack and the beanstalk but never quite finished reading noah's ark. Cheers.

Great actors, don't know anything about the director - I guess a quick peek in wiki can solve that - great human story encompassing a whole range of human emotions AND fantastic CGI effects!!!  It's a no brainer really.  I'm not expecting it to be accurate to Genesis in every detail...but, I guess there could be details that I find offensive. But at present, from the trailer, it's all good to me.  I enjoy watching Russel Crowe films and Anthony Hopkins as Methuselah (the oldest man who ever lived according to Genesis - 969 years old - who died the year the flood started and whose name in Hebrew conveys the idea of impending judgement at his death!!!  #perhaps there's a correlation to Methuselah being the oldest man who ever lived; a message in his very name and the wordwide flood....perhaps...#   So can't wait to see it! Hope it's good. If not, ah well, you win some, you lose some! ;o)

text: When you consider the poetic nature of the Bible and its stories, it only makes sense that directors like Darren Aronofsky would direct a film centered around its themes and imagery. The man is highly existential (The Fountain). The fluid and interpretative nature of the work permits the director to artistically portray and, dare I say, expand on the various elements.  This foundation must be had prior to seeing his films. Unfortunately, theists and atheists are too caught up in their own preconceived biases towards anything remotely affiliated with the "Bible" that they would rather sacrifice the entire film rather than give it a fair chance. Theists are not required to associate their faith and beliefs with everything that's written in the Bible. And, likewise, atheists are not expected to shun those who affiliate their lives with specific teachings. Both groups are certainly attempting to prop themselves up on some kind of intellectual pedestal which is, frankly speaking, a goal that is impossible for either group to obtain.   Who knows. Maybe it's how I was raised. :-\

text: Guys, you're claiming that the story of Noah was a fairy tale. Let's take this in consideration. The book of Genesis (that includes the story of Noah) was written a few thousand years before Jesus Christ was born. (we all know that) Now Noah was the 10th generation son from Adam's lineage (based on Genesis 5). So let's take the lineage from Adam to Noah. Adam, Seth, Enosh, Cainan, Mahalalel, Jared, Enoch, Methuselah, and Lamech bore Noah. Back in the days, either God told people to name their children names or people named them because there was a reason to name them the way they named them. So if you take these 10 names and see their meaning (e.g. Adam means "Man") then you come up with this sentence: "Man, Appointed, Mortal Sorrow, The Blessed God, Shall Come Down, Teaching, His death, Shall bring, Comfort and Rest" That shoots an arrow straight towards Jesus Christ. So you want to tell me that men who wrote "this Fairy tale" new that Jesus Christ will be born in this world, claim he is God and that he needs to die for the sins of the world so that people will find everlasting life through Jesus because He said "I'm the way, truth and life, no one comes to the Father except through me" ? Try to explain that one = )
author: Luckster 247

text: Guys, you're claiming that the story of Noah was a fairy tale. Let's take this in consideration. The book of Genesis (that includes the story of Noah) was written a few thousand years before Jesus Christ was born. (we all know that) Now Noah was the 10th generation son from Adam's lineage (based on Genesis 5). So let's take the lineage from Adam to Noah. Adam, Seth, Enosh, Cainan, Mahalalel, Jared, Enoch, Methuselah, and Lamech bore Noah. Back in the days, either God told people to name their children names or people named them because there was a reason to name them the way they named them. So if you take these 10 names and see their meaning (e.g. Adam means "Man") then you come up with this sentence: "Man, Appointed, Mortal, Sorrow, The Blessed God, Shall Come Down, Teaching, His Death Shall Bring, The Despairing, Comfort (or Rest)" That shoots an arrow straight towards Jesus Christ. So you want to tell me that men who wrote "this Fairy tale" knew that Jesus Christ will be born in this world, claim he is God and that he needs to die for the sins of the world so that people will find everlasting life through Jesus because He said "I'm the way, truth and life, no one comes to the Father except through me" ? Try to explain that one = ) ﻿

text: ( 1 )   Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment." ( 2 )   He said, "O my people, indeed I am to you a clear warner, ( 3 )   [Saying], 'Worship Allah, fear Him and obey me. ( 4 )   Allah will forgive you of your sins and delay you for a specified term. Indeed, the time [set by] Allah, when it comes, will not be delayed, if you only knew.' " ( 5 )   He said, "My Lord, indeed I invited my people [to truth] night and day. ( 6 )   But my invitation increased them not except in flight. ( 7 )   And indeed, every time I invited them that You may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, covered themselves with their garments, persisted, and were arrogant with [great] arrogance. ( 8 )   Then I invited them publicly. ( 9 )   Then I announced to them and [also] confided to them secretly ( 11 )   He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in [continuing] showers ( 12 )   And give you increase in wealth and children and provide for you gardens and provide for you rivers. ( 13 )   What is [the matter] with you that you do not attribute to Allah [due] grandeur ( 14 )   While He has created you in stages? ( 15 )   Do you not consider how Allah has created seven heavens in layers ( 16 )   And made the moon therein a [reflected] light and made the sun a burning lamp? ( 17 )   And Allah has caused you to grow from the earth a [progressive] growth. ( 18 )   Then He will return you into it and extract you [another] extraction. ( 19 )   And Allah has made for you the earth an expanse ( 20 )   That you may follow therein roads of passage.' " ( 21 )   Noah said, "My Lord, indeed they have disobeyed me and followed him whose wealth and children will not increase him except in loss. ( 22 )   And they conspired an immense conspiracy. ( 23 )   And said, 'Never leave your gods and never leave Wadd or Suwa' or Yaghuth and Ya'uq and Nasr. ( 24 )   And already they have misled many. And, [my Lord], do not increase the wrongdoers except in error." ( 25 )   Because of their sins they were drowned and put into the Fire, and they found not for themselves besides Allah [any] helpers. ( 26 )   And Noah said, "My Lord, do not leave upon the earth from among the disbelievers an inhabitant. ( 27 )   Indeed, if You leave them, they will mislead Your servants and not beget except [every] wicked one and [confirmed] disbeliever. ( 28 )   My Lord, forgive me and my parents and whoever enters my house a believer and the believing men and  quran 71
author: saleh ali

text: ( 25 )   And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Indeed, I am to you a clear warner ( 26 )   That you not worship except Allah. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a painful day." ( 27 )   So the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said, "We do not see you but as a man like ourselves, and we do not see you followed except by those who are the lowest of us [and] at first suggestion. And we do not see in you over us any merit; rather, we think you are liars." ( 28 )   He said, "O my people have you considered: if I should be upon clear evidence from my Lord while He has given me mercy from Himself but it has been made unapparent to you, should we force it upon you while you are averse to it? ( 29 )   And O my people, I ask not of you for it any wealth. My reward is not but from Allah. And I am not one to drive away those who have believed. Indeed, they will meet their Lord, but I see that you are a people behaving ignorantly. ( 30 )   And O my people, who would protect me from Allah if I drove them away? Then will you not be reminded? ( 31 )   And I do not tell you that I have the depositories [containing the provision] of Allah or that I know the unseen, nor do I tell you that I am an angel, nor do I say of those upon whom your eyes look down that Allah will never grant them any good. Allah is most knowing of what is within their souls. Indeed, I would then be among the wrongdoers." ( 32 )   They said, "O Noah, you have disputed us and been frequent in dispute of us. So bring us what you threaten us, if you should be of the truthful." ( 33 )   He said, "Allah will only bring it to you if He wills, and you will not cause [Him] failure. ( 34 )   And my advice will not benefit you - although I wished to advise you - If Allah should intend to put you in error. He is your Lord, and to Him you will be returned." ( 35 )   Or do they say [about Prophet Muhammad], "He invented it"? Say, "If I have invented it, then upon me is [the consequence of] my crime; but I am innocent of what [crimes] you commit." ( 36 )   And it was revealed to Noah that, "No one will believe from your people except those who have already believed, so do not be distressed by what they have been doing. ( 37 )   And construct the ship under Our observation and Our inspiration and do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are [to be] drowned." ( 38 )   And he constructed the ship, and whenever an assembly of the eminent of his people passed by him, they ridiculed him. He said, "If you ridicule us, then we will ridicule you just as you ridicule. ( 39 )   And you are going to know who will get a punishment that will disgrace him [on earth] and upon whom will descend an enduring punishment [in the Hereafter]." ( 40 )   [So it was], until when Our command came and the oven overflowed, We said, "Load upon the ship of each [creature] two mates and your family, except those about whom the word has preceded, and [include] whoever has believed." But none had believed with him, except a few. ( 41 )   And [Noah] said, "Embark therein; in the name of Allah is its course and its anchorage. Indeed, my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful." ( 42 )   And it sailed with them through waves like mountains, and Noah called to his son who was apart [from them], "O my son, come aboard with us and be not with the disbelievers." ( 43 )   [But] he said, "I will take refuge on a mountain to protect me from the water." [Noah] said, "There is no protector today from the decree of Allah, except for whom He gives mercy." And the waves came between them, and he was among the drowned. ( 44 )   And it was said, "O earth, swallow your water, and O sky, withhold [your rain]." And the water subsided, and the matter was accomplished, and the ship came to rest on the [mountain of] Judiyy. And it was said, "Away with the wrongdoing people." ( 45 )   And Noah called to his Lord and said, "My Lord, indeed my son is of my family; and indeed, Your promise is true; and You are the most just of judges!" ( 46 )   He said, "O Noah, indeed he is not of your family; indeed, he is [one whose] work was other than righteous, so ask Me not for that about which you have no knowledge. Indeed, I advise you, lest you be among the ignorant." ( 47 )   [Noah] said, "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from asking that of which I have no knowledge. And unless You forgive me and have mercy upon me, I will be among the losers." ( 48 )   It was said, "O Noah, disembark in security from Us and blessings upon you and upon nations [descending] from those with you. But other nations [of them] We will grant enjoyment; then there will touch them from Us a painful punishment." ( 49 )   That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muhammad]. You knew it not, neither you nor your people, before this. So be patient; indeed, the [best] outcome is for the righteous. quran 11

text: This movie was fantastic.  It asks all the difficult questions the Noah story brings up: Did the rest of the world really deserve to die?  What was it like for Noah to have the responsibility of the earth's future in his hands?  Does humanity deserve a second chance?  Can we own that responsibility and be the creation we were meant to be?   Noah, to be sure, is a religious epic, but one that is presented as part of the full mythology of the book of Genesis.  It should not offend the faithful or the skeptic, but should challenge and entertain them both.  Go see it.

text: Just watched this movie, an interesting and great film with stunning visual effects, if you're going to watch it and you have strong opinions on things, please be a little open minded. Firstly you have to commend the producers and director for taking on an extremely difficult story to bring to the big screen. In a strict biblical sense, this movie does deviate from the pure story, abuses poetic license a bit too much (spoilers) such as with the giant angel-stone-monster things. Although if you are religious please respect that while the movie is a little too superficial, the message the movie conveys is a great one. The second half of the movie is fantastic in displaying the dynamics of human character, and wraps the story up nicely with no cringeworthy cliches.  PLEASE have an open mind about this movie and respect it for what it is.

author: Painter Dood

text: Do NOT go see Noah the movie!!!! As I said, I walked out of it (one of the first I have ever walked out of). I went trying to give Hollywood the benefit of the doubt, knowing that they would need to add some artistic interpretation given the small storyline from Genesis.  However, when Hollywood injected the idea that Noah couldn't get answers from God and wanted to murder his granddaughter, I couldn't stand it anymore. I was disgusted by the portrayal of an axe wielding Noah who kills countless people. I was appalled by the fact that they made up a storyline that a bad guy secretly snuck on to the boat and conspired with Ham to kill Noah while on the boat. I was offended that they portrayed a prophet as a man not preaching repentance but as a man determined to end the human race including his own family. Besides the fact that there is a man with a boat and animals, this movie in no way follows the story found in Genesis.  With only three chapters about Noah, it is surprising how many errors this movie has compared to its biblical telling (eg. age of noah, sons all took wives on to boat, length of ark stay, his interaction with his father and Methuselah, in Bible it said Noah walked with God etc).  I didn't find out until after the fact the Noah’s Film atheist director Darren Aronofsky Calls 'Noah' The 'Least Biblical Film Ever Made" (Huffington Post).

author: Rob H

text: Saw Noah last night. The film is so deeply steeped in philosophically challenging issues having to do with the wickedness of man that a moral philosopher could write a paper from it. Overall I thought it was visually stunning, meticulously executed, and just went well beyond my cautiously optimistic expectations. Additional thoughts:  Yes, you should see it.  No, you don't have to be religious to enjoy it (I'm not).  Yes, there are some environmentalist undertones having to do with good stewardship of the earth (shock, horror), but they're not overbearing. No, the film isn't sacrilegious.  Yes, it departs from the Genesis account of the flood in favor of mythology from the non-canonical Book of Enoch (hence the Watchers).  No, the fact that it departs from the Genesis account doesn't matter.  Yes, there are overarching Biblical themes about divine justice and mercy that are powerfully conveyed.  No, you might not want to bring your grandmother and her Sunday school class — the film is very dark and violent.  9/10 stars. And I'm a picky moviegoer.

author: WorldCGI

text: Im a fan of aronofsky's films and I was let down but not surprised when I saw this film.  you could tell that the studio had its way and its say with this thing.  it would've been very interesting to see the original script for this movie.  but it fell far short of the abilities of the director.. the editing and the flow of the film as well as some truly hokey and UN-Aronofsky moments in the dialogue and acting all showed that his heart had been taken out of this film by the pressure from the higher-ups.. it was a mess, and I don't think it was aronofsky's fault.  I read where the studio exec's demanded that he change his original ideas... and I have a feeling that those changes were far more than marginal.  this film was totalllllllly phoned in by everybody involved.  save your money and go rent black swan or Pi.  Ive been waiting for this thing ever since I read where he was planning on it in an interview with aronofsky.. but when I read about the conflicts with the studio execs shortly after production started I pretty much knew it was going to be a goose egg.  Imagine what works of art these studios would produce if they'd just let their talent do what they do best and CREATE!   Oh, and yeah, I am a believer... but whats that got to do with whether a work is art or a fart?  you can appreciate art and still believe in Christ.. Dr.Francis Schaeffer and CS Lewis are prime examples of this.  And if youre wondering, I thought Son of God had its heart in the right place but just wasn't very good, even though I kind of liked the lead actors portrayal of Jesus.  I don't think they'll ever produce a good film about Christ just as much as I don't think they'll ever get something like Frankenstein straight.  I just wish they'd make a high production value film adaptation of a Lovecraft story, without taking a bunch of liberties like they did in Noah!    and that's my arc.. RIM SHOT!

I may eventually watch it at some point in the future, but not at the theaters...God I pray for all the people that were involved with this movie, may you show them mercy and your true love..  2 Timothy 3  3 But mark this: There will be terrible times in the last days. 2 People will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, boastful, proud, abusive, disobedient to their parents, ungrateful, unholy, 3 without love, unforgiving, slanderous, without self-control, brutal, not lovers of the good, 4 treacherous, rash, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God— 5 having a form of godliness but denying its power. Have nothing to do with such people.  6 They are the kind who worm their way into homes and gain control over gullible women, who are loaded down with sins and are swayed by all kinds of evil desires, 7 always learning but never able to come to a knowledge of the truth. 8 Just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so also these teachers oppose the truth. text: SPOILERS, SO IF YOU WANNA SEE THE MOVIE, DON'T READ ME!       Even though this has the basis of the Biblical story of Noahs Ark, it has a lot of none Biblical elements ( Stone angels known as The Watchers, the wife of Shem is steril, Noah tries to kill the twin daughters of Shem, Ham caring  for Tubal-cain, the main antagonist of the film, who snuck on the Ark, Ham and Japheth not having any wives aboard the Ark, a snakeskin that was shed by the snake in Eden is used as a sign of birthright, etc). Even so, the film was very well executed and thought out, letting the director and writers expand their ideas of what the story would have been.  In truth, it is a very good movie, and I highly recommend it, even if you aren't the religious type, because it blends religion with fantasy in an excellent way.  8/10, would watch again once on Netflix.

text: I only have one word for this movie. Hypocritical, and far from the original text weather you're christian, Muslim, or Jewish.  In the movie it promotes vegetarianism. But many of the animals on the ark were carnivores. We can't eat meat, no. But a lion can?  Noah Kills a man for killing an animal for food. (HYPOCRITICAL) When did animals become more important than a human being?  One moment in the movie Noah's son picks a flower, and Noah tells him he shouldn't do that, and yet the whole basis of the story is revolved around cutting down trees and using it to build a big ark.  They also used a Jewish tradition and made it seem demonic. Noah raps his arm with snake skin, from the same snake that tempted Adam and eve (aka the Devil) The movie made it seem that Noah gave the Devil's blessing to his grandchildren. What THE heck?  And fallen angels aka (DEMONS) were good. I see this movie as a fantasy movie nothing more. If you haven't read the bible and/or other religious texts, and think that  this is really close to the story try reading it for yourself, and you will notice a huge difference. There is actually less fantasy in the real story. Trust me. The story of Noah is what I like to call a legend, and if you're going to do a movie about a legend you should make it as close as possible to the original text considering 3 major religions of the world cherish this story. My guess is - after it reaches stores it will sit on the shelf.

text: This movie has to be on the worst biblical films I've ever seen. I can't believe my mom took me to even watch this movie.  It's so obvious that the creators of this film hadn't even read the Bible.  A Pagan Witch Doctor? Fallen Angels as rock creatures? They can't even say God's name, instead they call him 'the creator'. Tubal-Cain shouldn't even be in the boat at all. And WTF!? Noah going to kill his granddaugthers like some psychopath?  More importantly: no mention of the Nephilim!? That was the major reason God flood the earth. If you don't know, the Nephilim are cannibalistic giants that lived before the time of Noah, the spawn of a forbidden union between a Fallen Angel and a human woman. This, in turn, prompted God to make the Great Flood.  These fallen angels, The Watchers (Also known as the Grigori) were never allies like in this movie. In reality, they were actually the ones who made the Nephlim and are the ones who brung forbiddne knowledge to humans such as sorcery, weaponry, cosmetics, and others.  They were never saved like in the movie. As punishment for their treachery, God banished them to reside within the valley of the earth until Judgement Day.  I hope this movie bombs. If Hollywood is going so far as to go to the Bible for movie ideas, then they are running out of ideas.

Also, Noah was like 700 years old when he built the Ark, and died age 950. text: This was such a wonderful movie!  Lots of creative license was taken, but if you watch with an open mind, anyone can get a great deal of enjoyment from it.  I feel so inspired and enriched after watching it (and I am not Christian).  The message of the story is that what makes us worthy and good is to act out of love.  That is a message that everyone can find meaning in.  Such a great film, I hope people give it a chance instead of just judging it by hearsay.

text: The true story of NOAH PBUH:  Nûḥ (Arabic: نوح, translit.: Nūḥ),[1] known as Noah in the Old Testament, is recognized in Islam as a prophet and apostle of God (Arabic: الله‎ Allāh). He is a highly important figure in Islamic history, as he is counted amongst the earliest prophets sent by God to mankind.[2] According to Islam, Noah's mission was to save a wicked world, plunged in (Mainly Polytheism and worshipping Idols, just like the christians Polytheism worshiping Jesus and Marry)* depravity and sin. God charged Noah with the duty of preaching to his people to make them abandon idolatry and to worship only the One Creator and to live good and pure lives.[3] Although he preached the Message of God with immense zeal, his people refused to mend their ways, leading to his building of the Ark and the famous event of the Deluge, the Great Flood in which all the evil people of his time perished. Noah preached faith in God for 950 years according to Quran.[4]  Noah's mission had a double character: he had to warn his people, asking them to call for repentance and, at the same time, he had to preach about God's mercy and forgiveness, promising them the glad tidings God would provide if they led righteous lives. References to Noah are scattered throughout the Qur'an, and there is even an entire chapter carrying his name, Noah.[5]  From Wikipedia. *Mine

text: When I watched the trailer I was really excited about this movie. But simple I am disappointing with Darren Aronofsky work. And I am not saying this as a Hardcore Religion Fan more like a person who had read the book. I know  that Noah movie is only 3 chapters and left to many thing to a 2 hours movie. But the changes they made were unacceptable. 1) Angels were never here on earth to help. Indeed they were the ones who actually made the big mess on earth because they came to earth to have sex with women. And just for that. 2) The hybrid sons of the angels with women were the giants, not the watchers. And they didn't have an elemental form of rocks, they were simple giant humans about 3m to 5m tall 3) Noah took about 40 years to build the ark 4) All of their son were married when they entered the ark and that is really important  Like I said I am reader not a hardcore fan.  I would felt this way if they mess up with other great movies like. Catching fire, lord of the rings or they really mess up with a batman movie.  But everybody is free to accept or reject how a movie is made. :)

text: Well, it wasn't boring.  But dark (at times very) and pretty emotionally charged at times (man, talk about cabin fever - scheesh) - but hey, it's an Aronofsky film, so brace yourself. Good acting, and very beautifully shot. A lot of tasteful, appropriate and interesting imagery.  It takes some liberties with the Biblical story (which in turn took liberties with the Babylonian one), So if you are of the "Biblical inerrancy rulz" clan, then this movie might not be for you.  Early chapters of the Book of Genesis are some of my favorite (and I am an atheist).  Too bad (or maybe good?) they can't make a movie for Ecclesiastes, Proverbs or Job - the other gems of the Bible. In either case, the flood story is a very good myth and the quality of the movie lives up to it - in my opinion.  So, basically, with a few caveat emptors I highly recommend it. If you go see it, prepare to see something that is ultimately hopeful, and yet (perhaps in part because hope requires it) is very very dark at the same time.

text: 25. We sent Noah to his people, "I am to you a clear warner."  26. "That you shall worship none but God. I fear for you the agony of a painful Day."  27. The notables who disbelieved among his people said, "We see in you nothing but a man like us, and we see that only the worst among us have followed you, those of immature judgment. And we see that you have no advantage over us. In fact, we think you are liars."  28. He said, "O my people, Have you considered? If I stand on clear evidence from my Lord, and He has given me a mercy from Himself, but you were blind to it, can we compel you to accept it, even though you dislike it?"  29. "O my people! I ask of you no money for it. My reward lies only with God. And I am not about to dismiss those who believed; they will surely meet their Lord. And I see that you are ignorant people."  30. "O my people! Who will support me against God, if I dismiss them? Will you not give a thought?"  31. "I do not say to you that I possess the treasures of God, nor do I know the future, nor do I say that I am an angel. Nor do I say of those who are despicable in your eyes that God will never give them any good. God is Aware of what lies in their souls. If I did, I would be one of the wrongdoers."  32. They said, "O Noah, you have argued with us, and argued a great deal. Now bring upon us what you threaten us with, if you are truthful."  33. He said, "It is God who will bring it upon you, if He wills, and you will not be able to escape."  34. "My advice will not benefit you, much as I may want to advise you, if God desires to confound you. He is your Lord, and to Him you will be returned."  35. Or do they say, "He made it up?" Say, "If I made it up, upon me falls my crime, and I am innocent of the crimes you commit."  36. And it was revealed to Noah: "None of your people will believe, except those who have already believed, so do not grieve over what they do."  37. "And build the Ark, under Our eyes, and with Our inspiration, and do not address Me regarding those who did wrong; they are to be drowned."  38. As he was building the ark, whenever some of his people passed by him, they ridiculed him. He said, "If you ridicule us, we will ridicule you, just as you ridicule."  39. "You will surely know upon whom will come a torment that will abase him, and upon whom will fall a lasting torment."  40. Until, when Our command came, and the volcano erupted, We said, "Board into it a pair of every kind, and your family-except those against whom the sentence has already been passed-and those who have believed." But those who believed with him were only a few.  41. He said, "Embark in it. In the name of God shall be its sailing and its anchorage. My Lord is indeed Forgiving and Merciful."  42. And so it sailed with them amidst waves like hills. And Noah called to his son, who had kept away, "On my son! Embark with us, and do not be with the disbelievers."  43. He said, "I will take refuge on a mountain-it will protect me from the water." He said, "There is no protection from God's decree today, except for him on whom He has mercy." And the waves surged between them, and he was among the drowned.  44. And it was said, "O earth, swallow your waters," and "O heaven, clear up." And the waters receded, and the event was concluded, and it settled on Judi, and it was proclaimed: "Away with the wicked people."  45. And Noah called to his Lord. He said, "O My Lord, my son is of my family, and Your promise is true, and You are the Wisest of the wise."  46. He said, "O Noah, he is not of your family. It is an unrighteous deed. So do not ask Me about something you know nothing about. I admonish you, lest you be one of the ignorant."  47. He said, "O My Lord, I seek refuge with You, from asking You about what I have no knowledge of. Unless You forgive me, and have mercy on me, I will be one of the losers."  48. It was said, "O Noah, disembark with peace from Us; and with blessings upon you, and upon communities from those with you. And other communities We will grant prosperity, and then a painful torment from Us will befall them."  49. These are some stories from the past that we reveal to you. Neither you, nor your people knew them before this. So be patient. The future belongs to the pious.  Quran (11/25-49)

text: For anyone who believes the worldwide Flood didn't happen, the billions of fossils that are found worldwide, including on top of mountains, are very strong evidence that the Genesis Flood is a part of Earth's history. Fossils cannot form by slow burial over millions of years, because predators and parasites would devour a dead creature within weeks, and its bones scattered. This fact debunks the geologic column and further gives credence to the worldwide Flood, because most fossils are articulated fossils, which means, they're found with the bones connected, and they're found preserved. Fossilization requires a quick burial, as from mudslides that were caused by a Flood, otherwise, as I've already pointed out, the creatures' bones would be scattered, and predators and parasites would devour a creature so that nothing is preserved. The OBSERVABLE facts back up the biblical account of the worldwide Flood, while at the same time, debunks Darwinism.  Another fact, which many evolutionary scientists have admitted, including Stephen J. Gould, Colin Patterson, and Niles Eldredge, is that the transitional or intermediate fossils are completely ABSENT from the fossil record. This fact also debunks Darwinism, and is exactly what is expected from the Genesis Flood scenario.﻿

text: I realise the source material is still a bit of a loaded gun, but once you accept that its okay to make films about Christian myths and treat them like other myth, (ie ancient greek/viking etc myths) it shouldn't carry any offence. No-one has a problem with the retelling of Greek myths being portrayed on screen (I.e. Clash of the titans, Beowulf, Troy, Hercules), so in theory why should anyone regard Biblical myths any differently. Then again the only issue is, people still believe in Christian myths as truth for some reason (bizarre), unlike ancient Greek myths...and do stupid things like stopping gays getting married as a result.  But if you approach it rationally and academically, anyone can enjoy this as a fantasy film (as it clearly is meant to be), just like Lord of the Rings/Clash of the titans/Thor/Game of Thrones etc.

text: This movie is completely off from the original biblical account of the flood.  Scene 2:06, for example, is ridiculous.
