text: Nûḥ (Arabic: نوح, translit.: Nūḥ), known as Noah in the Old Testament, is recognized in Islam as a prophet and apostle of God (Arabic: الله‎ Allāh). He is a highly important figure in Islamic history, as he is counted amongst the earliest prophets sent by God to mankind. According to Islam, Noah's mission was to save a wicked world, plunged in depravity and sin. God charged Noah with the duty of preaching to his people to make them abandon idolatry and to worship only the One Creator and to live good and pure lives. Although he preached the Message of God with immense zeal, his people refused to mend their ways, leading to his building of the Ark and the famous event of the Deluge, the Great Flood in which all the evil people of his time perished. Noah preached faith in God for 950 years according to Quran.  Noah's mission had a double character: he had to warn his people, asking them to call for repentance and, at the same time, he had to preach about God's mercy and forgiveness, promising them the glad tidings God would provide if they led righteous lives. References to Noah are scattered throughout the Qur'an, and there is even an entire chapter carrying his name, Noah.
author: Kamoliddin Sadikov

text: One day, Noah received a revelation from God, in which he was told that no one would believe the message now aside from those who have already submitted to God.[17] Noah's frustration at the defiance of his people led him to ask God to not leave even one sinner upon earth. Thereupon, God decreed that a terrible flood would cover the whole earth and He ordered Noah to build an Ark which would save him and the believers from this dreadful calamity.[18] Ever obedient to God's instructions, Noah went out in search of material with which to build the vessel.  Exegesis narrates that, in the land where Noah lived, vegetation was scarce and so Noah had to plant trees and wait for them to grow before beginning work on the Ark. When Noah began building the Ark, the people who saw him at work laughed at him even more than before. Their conclusion was that he was surely a madman – they could not find any other reason why a man would build a huge vessel when no sea or river was nearby. Although Noah was now very old, the aged patriarch continued to work tirelessly until, at last, the Ark was finished.
author: Kamoliddin Sadikov

text: The Qu'ran states that Noah was inspired by God, like other Islamic prophets such as Ibrāhīm (Abraham), Ismā'īl (Ishmael), Ishaq (Isaac), Ya'qub (Jacob), Isa (Jesus), Ilyas‘ (Elijah), Ayub (Job), Harun (Aaron), Yunus (Jonah), Daud (David) and Muhammad (Mohammed), and that he was a faithful messenger. Noah had firm belief in the oneness of God, and preached Islam (literally "submission," meaning submission to God).  He continuously warned the people of the painful doom that was coming and asked them to accept one God instead of worshipping idols such as Wadd, Suwa', Yaghuth, Ya'uq and Nasr. He called the people to serve God, and said that nobody but God could save them. He said that the time of the deluge was appointed and could not be delayed, and that the people had to submit to God.  God commanded Noah to build a ship, the Ark, and as he was building it, the chieftains passed him and mocked him. Upon its completion, the ship is said to be loaded with pairs of every animal available that time, and Noah's household, and 76 believers who did submit to God. The people who denied the message of Noah, including one of his own sons, drowned.The final resting place of the ship was referred to as Mount Judi.Noah is called a grateful servant.Both Noah and Abraham were taught the prophethood and the scripture.

text: God is a god of love and justice.  It was out of MERCY that God destroyed the world with a flood anciently because as Genesis 6 and 7 describes it man had become EXCEEDINGLY wicked and their imagination was evil continually, and VIOLENCE was rampant upon the earth, TERRIBLE violence.  How would the world have been today if the wickedness that was so terrible that it threatened safety everywhere was not checked? The antediluvian world was also guilty of the most outrageous crimes of science.  They were so advanced that they were able to combine human DNA and animal DNA to create other life forms--the dinosaurs.  If there was one crime above all that caused the judgements of God to destroy the old world it was this.  God is holy and righteous, and He will destroy ANYTHING and ANYONE who comes into conflict with His authority.  God is not the puny, sentimental being that the poor churches of today are promoting with their love gospel.  Once again, the ANCIENT OF DAYS will arise to shake both heaven and earth.  Once again, He will intervene to check the wickedness of man—but this time PERMANENTLY--which He has allowed, AMAZINGLY (merciful god!), to pass almost beyond the point of His patience, but only for a season.  THE WORLD IS LIVING ON BORROWED TIME.  And Christ did say that the world will become just like it was in the days of Noah. Erelong the world will witness a demonstration of the great and terrible power of the LIVING GOD in which sinners and mockers alike will tremble and grope in abject terror before His AWFUL MAJESTY awaiting their terrible sentence amidst horrors unlike ANYTHING that the world has ever seen.  God will not long be mocked.

text: The movie does send a message acknowledging earth as authored by a Creator. (as opposed to protracted evolutionary eons of time. The author managed to create a very gripping surreal movie using Noah's story as the backdrop of the narrative. Besides the image of God as Creator the message the movie sent about Noah's God was one of an irrational, vindictive, intolerant higher being. The movie failed miserably to portray biblical truth  as it failed to depict Noah as a preacher of hope and of a real serious message. Rather, Noah made no attempt to persuade his generation of putting faith in what the higher being was revealing concerning the future, and to encourage them to come into the ark and save themselves. The ark was for his family ONLY because they were the chosen ones. (have you seen ethnicities with that same mentality before?)  they did build a private ark. From a bibliocentric perspective, the story line reveals an account that could be conceived as a Harry Potter's version of the bible account of the flood, inescapably filled with distortions of a  message intended to show Love and justice and intent to save. A rainbow-less message crafted to attract many christians and people who are curious about bible history but who will not read it from the bible itself. Definitely a monetary investment that will attract thousands to the screen and keep the money flowing into multibiollion doolar industry of Hollywood's cosmology.

text: Supremely disappointed in this film. I had little expectation of it being close to Biblical account (although the trailers showed a film in which appropriate artistic liberties were taken while holding to the original story), but I hoped for a story in which those artistic liberties simply filled in some of the "holes" left in Genesis: what would other people do when the floods came, how did Noah protect his family, how did they manage that many live animals on a boat, etc, etc. In a story that already had a pretty unusual premise, Aronofsky took miles when inches would have done.

text: I loved this film even if I don't personally believe the Great Flood happened as far as it being a punishment from God goes. Personally I think the story of the Great Flood is partial memory of various tsunamis that we know from archaeological evidence devastated Europe after the end of the last great Ice Age as the sea levels rose. That doesn't make the story any less significant. It is one of the Great Old Stories of Mankind and this film did it justice even if it didn't follow holy writ and scientific knowledge to the letter. It blended the two as seamlessly as it could especially when Noah told his family the story of Genesis interspersed with the formation of the Sol System, the Earth and Moon, evolution and the rise of humanity. Top notch performances from Russel Crowe, Emma Watson and Ray Winston is as gloriously hammy as ever.

author: Rancis Morris

text: "With sweeping visuals grounded by strong performances in service of a timeless tale told on a human scale, Darren Aronofsky's Noah brings the Bible epic into the 21st century." - Rotten Tomatoes' Critic's Consenus, which gave Noah 77% positive out 207 critic reviews... It isn't a terrible film, as most of the audience members/cinema-goers seem to make out, but the beginning is an endurance test. However, Noah has scenes of spectacle, stunning visuals, intensity and well-acted drama, especially when they are on the ark, but it never quite meets its full potential, though the way it was made is interesting, as it lacks the full-on momentum, power, destruction and cleansing of the Flood, and it's brave of Aronofsky not to directly refer to God, as it becomes more accessible, but it lacks spirituality, it lacks heart and by the end, it leaves you feeling either refreshed, wanting to do good or a bit cold and empty and disappointed. It's received a mixed reaction and rightly so; it isn't groundbreaking, it isn't spectacular, it isn't Oscar-calibre as some may have hoped, it is somewhat disappointing, I'll further stress that it can be infuriatingly boring but it isn't terrible, it is well-directed, well-cast with Russell Crowe brilliant as the tormented, flawed but just Noah, wrestling with this domestic melodrama and psychological realism, and the beautiful Emma Watson doing a decent job of his adopted daughter (although she is no Jennifer Lawrence, I hope her career may last long, that she will become more and more versatile, that with experience, she will grow and evolve into an excellent actress/actor, which I wish upon all the young, former Harry Potter cast and that her ambition, intelligence and emotional maturity will take her all the way to an Oscar, which I particularly wish upon the Potter franchise's main three: Daniel, Emma, Rupert), and visually breathtaking.

text: This movie was really disturbing.  Yes the movie was inaccurate within accordance to the bible.  With that aside the movie it's self was politically driven at every corner to promote broken family, feminism, defaming men, discrediting the story it's self.  First and foremost I found the movie disturbing concerning the baby and Cain's involvement in the film.  Making the evil fallen angels seem good never happened in any bible story.  The eating of meat; God said at the end of Noah's story that he gave the animals to man kind to be used for "food".  Finally the number of creatures on the Arc was inaccurate.  The bible does say a male and female, a pare of each kind, but goes further in saying; 1 pare of unclean animals, and 7 pares of clean animals.  This is to discredit the idea of eating meat since all animals would be extinct only after eating one of each kind.  So by leaving out the 7 pares of clean animals would ether discredit the bible story or give credit to the anti meat eater movement.  Furthermore we had the anti-anarchy statement of what would happen if lawlessness would take hold when men would sell their women for food.  Basically this movie was screaming; "don't trust men; don't rely on men; don't let men be close with your baby; men are evil; ect".  Movies like this are a perfect example of what is wrong with our society.  We should be making movies which promote family and unity.  In my opinion of this movie the writer must have had the most twisted barbaric personality disorder to conceive such a script.  The bible also states that Noah found favor in the eye's of God so God decided to save Noah, his family, and the beast.  Never did the bible say that his intentions were to make man extinct.  I nearly walked out of the movie I was so disgusted with the ill intentions of the film.  I don't mind being entertained, but if you're going to make a movie based on scripture, then you need to do so word for word; whether you agree with the word or not.  This is basically a slap in the face to all of those who do believe; promoting poverty, division, and crippling our social structure from within via this brain washing BS.

text: I've heard one of the biggest criticisms of this film is that it uses the word Creator instead of God. I am not quite sure what the problem is since the word god is not a name but a title. In fact it seems to me that the word creator would be more in keeping with a monotheistic religion. What do I mean? Well Zeus is a god, so is Odin, so is Marduk or even Hadad.  Mentioning the word god in a time when people worshiped many different ones in my mind would be running counter to the spirit of having a close relationship with the divine creator. Your just lumping him in with all the other gods out there. Its like every time you see your best friend and instead of saying hey Paul you just say hey friend.  To take it a step further the Semitic word Baal originally meant Lord or god. Since this is set in pretty much the same region wouldn't that have been a more acceptable title for the film?

I guess we please him these days so let the dancing continue. Noah only took half the animals on the Ark....the other half were in the water already so the flood just gave them more territory. The story of Biblical Noah has many earlier versions in Greek mythlogy and in Sumarian stories. The "Epic of Gilgamesh" is a earlier version of the flood. There is no way an Ark can contain all the animal pooh that would be excreted by the multitude of animals in 40 days unless God constipated them. text: Here it is the 100% true story of noah “Embark therein; in the Name of God will be its course and its anchorage.  Surely, my Lord is Oft Forgiving, most Merciful.  So it sailed with them amidst waves like mountains...” (Quran 11:41) “And Noah called out to his son, who had separated himself (apart), ‘O my son!  Embark with us and be not with the disbelievers.’  The son replied, ‘I will betake myself to a mountain; it will save me from the water.’  Noah said: ‘This day there is no saviour from the Decree of God except him on whom He has mercy.’  And a wave came in between them so he (the son) was among the drowned.” (Quran 11:42-43) The Flood Ends “‘O Earth!  Swallow up your water, and O sky!  Withhold (your rain).’  The water was diminished (made to subside) and the Decree (of God) was fulfilled (the destruction of the people of Noah).  And it (the ship) rested on Mount Judi, and it was said: ‘Away with the people who are wrongdoing.’” (Quran 11:44) “O my Lord!  Verily my son is of my family!  And certainly your promise is true and you are the Most Just of the judges.” (Quran 11:45) “He said: ‘Oh Noah!  Surely, he is not of your family; verily, his work is unrighteous, so ask not of Me that of which you have no knowledge!  I admonish you, lest you be one of the ignorants.’” (Quran 11:46) Noah understood.  He said; “O my Lord!  I seek refuge with You from asking from You that of which I have no knowledge.  And unless You forgive me and have Mercy on me, I would indeed be one of the losers.” (Quran 11:47)

text: My dad claimed this as the worse bastardization of a biblical story since the Epic of Gilgamesh, and I must agree as this is most definitely not the story of Noah, because his son's had wives. God had told Noah that he wanted to purge evil from the world and that it was fine for all of them to continue on living. And for those who think otherwise here's some proof, of why this is a bad adaptation of a biblical story   18 But I will establish my covenant with you, and you will enter the ark—you and your sons and your wife and your sons’ wives with you. 19 You are to bring into the ark two of all living creatures, male and female, to keep them alive with you. 20 Two of every kind of bird, of every kind of animal and of every kind of creature that moves along the ground will come to you to be kept alive. 21 You are to take every kind of food that is to be eaten and store it away as food for you and for them.”   9 Then God blessed Noah and his sons, saying to them, “Be fruitful and increase in number and fill the earth. 2 The fear and dread of you will fall on all the beasts of the earth, and on all the birds in the sky, on every creature that moves along the ground, and on all the fish in the sea; they are given into your hands. 3 Everything that lives and moves about will be food for you. Just as I gave you the green plants, I now give you everything.  4 “But you must not eat meat that has its lifeblood still in it. 5 And for your lifeblood I will surely demand an accounting. I will demand an accounting from every animal. And from each human being, too, I will demand an accounting for the life of another human being.  6 “Whoever sheds human blood,     by humans shall their blood be shed; for in the image of God     has God made mankind. 7 As for you, be fruitful and increase in number; multiply on the earth and increase upon it.”  8 Then God said to Noah and to his sons with him: 9 “I now establish my covenant with you and with your descendants after you 10 and with every living creature that was with you—the birds, the livestock and all the wild animals, all those that came out of the ark with you—every living creature on earth. 11 I establish my covenant with you: Never again will all life be destroyed by the waters of a flood; never again will there be a flood to destroy the earth.”  Noah was kind man and I have been informed by my dad that Noah lived near people and they didn't believe him about the on coming flood. As well he had neighbors, not giant rock monster angel things, to help him in building the ark. And they were allowed to board the ark because they believed and were nice people. So all in all it was an okay movie if you were just looking for an action flick that has a little drama in it, other wise it's just a really bad adaptation of a bible story

text: What a fantastic movie. Everything works here - the story, the script, acting is top notch (casting director did a great job), CGI is very good, production values are phenomenal. One thing that really stands out is how well they told 2 conflicting stories regarding humans that blindly believe in God and everything he represents, and others who think that we are the masters of our destiny and no one, including creator can't do anything about that.  Yes, this movie took some liberties in storytelling and i liked it even more because of it. I mean we all know the story - why not make it interesting? I really liked Noah  - he was such a complex character( person who was so faithful that he couldn't even recognize what is right and what is wrong causing him to almost kill infants), i also liked stone giants, it was refreshing to see them and it made sense in regards of building an arc. Main villain was also good - he represented everything wrong with society but he had some valid points that made you rethink the whole flooding event. Overall if you appreciate good movie give NOAH a chance, pull your finger out of your ass if you're christian fundamentalist and enjoy yourself. 4,5 / 5!

author: Kristine Marie

text: This movie is so wrong!!  It's as if the producer of this movie is an atheist and all he wants is to depict our great Prophet Noah as a mad man! Or some one who did not know what he was doing. A merciless, cruel man. This is far from our prophet!!  He was a kind merciful man who tried to warn people of the flood for many years!!! He wanted to save people!!! Not leave them to drown. People did not believe him about the flood and God and they used to mock him when he built the arch!! And they CHOSE not to come into the arch, except a group of believers in God and his message!! This movie shows that Noah thought God did not want to save the human race, if that were true then why would God command him to build an arc!! Through out the whole movie Noah is depicted as a man who does not care for the people around him, at one point he even leaves an injured girl behind!!! He is shown to be some one who others have to talk sense into him and constantly question him!  These are all lies fabricated against our great prophets!!! To top it off he is shown later on in the movie as a drunk man!! Our prophets never drank! They were strong, pious, kind men who loved their fellow men and wanted to warn them against committing bad deeds and injustice!!  This is a very false version of what actually happens and a complete injustice to prophet Noah's true character and nobility!!   Hollywood had no boundaries, and unfortunately a lack of boundaries invites a lack of respect!    Please refer to the Quran, surah 71 Nuh (Noah) for God shows him as an honourable man.

text: Only the arrogants who use science to justify one's philosophical view with or without god does not deserve the decency to talk about science. Those people who put god in trial under science fail to realize that science only deals with tentative explanations for a certain phenomenon and hold it until a better one comes. Science does not deal with what created this, but rather how it works. Does science ever bother to demonstrate what created gravity in the first place? No, but they do know it exists and try to explain what it is or how it works. There's a reason why hypothesis is mentioned in the scientific method. It is to explain how something works, not demonstrate who or what created it. Anything that involves a testable and falsifiable explanation falls in the realm of science. Anything else like saying what is real or what created this falls in the realm of philosophy and is nothing more but pseudo-science. How exactly did the laws of physics, atoms, etc. started in the first place? This question is not for us to ponder in science since it is impossible to demonstrate its origin without relying on theoretical assumptions which philosophical scientists frequently rely on. Theoretical has no room in science but the empirical and experimental.

text: This is one of the most inaccurate Bible depictions ever. I am talking to those who believe in the Bible. You who are atheists and don't believe in God can just shut up because I know what you're going to say. First of all, it isn't historically correct. They have forges and steel in this movie! I mean really?? Steel wasn't invented until long after Noah's time and the forge was, too. What was that flare-like thing that Tubal Cain shot into the air, too? It must have been operated through some sort of gunpowder of some sort. Theologically, this movie is all types of messed up. The fallen angels (Satan and his demons) did not help Noah in ANYTHING. Tubal Cain did not slip aboard the Ark and eat the animals. Nowhere in the Bible did Shem become tempted by that idiot. No children were born in the Ark according to the Bible. There was definitely no "war" among Noah and the pagans. If the director ever read the Bible (I'm assuming he didn't), all they did was laugh at him and persecute him through their words. All three sons had wives before the flood. No animals were eaten on the Ark. Noah's grandson's were born AFTER the Flood. Most of all, the movie stated the God was angry at the pagan's because of "the destruction of His land".... REALLY? God was angry because the pagans hated God and profained Him in every way. It's no wonder why atheists think we're strange. It's people like these idiot directors who mess the whole movie up to make it "look more action-packed". The bottom line is that this was a very bad movie and it was told in the most false ways.

text: I love this movie. Instead of going to blows over it's biblical inaccuracies, I think there's something much more important about this film. Isn't it more important that the word of God is spread? Even if there are some things that aren't exactly faithful to the bible, changed for the sake of art, isn't it more important that people see and be inspired by it? If people feel inspired to be better humans, to look deeper into religion than stereotypes and first impressions, this movie has done its job. It also humanizes the bible in such a significant way, making each of us feel that there is humanity in the history depicted by the bible, makes us feel closer to our biblical heroes, less like we are merely sinners, mere dots that do not deserve to live because we could never compare with the flawless beings we have been told about.

text: Terrible movie! Just finished watching and I wish I had listened to my wife who told me not to! The satanic Hollywood has just brutalized another story of another prophet; changing facts, insulting religion (whether you believe in God or not, remember that some DO, so yes it is an insult or worse a blasphemy!) and as usual yet again rewriting history as it pleases them. Again, whether you believe in Noah's story or not, it simply doesn't change the fact that Hollywood changed that story and made a prophet look so obsessed with killing innocents! They didn't just stop there, but also made it look like as if God wanted some blood sacrifice from Noah to somehow be satisfied! A horrible movie! Pure waste of time! And if you are a religious person who believes in God and his prophets, whether you're a Muslim, a Christian or Jewish, just do yourself a favour and do NOT watch this devilish piece of blasphemy!

Why o why did they have to use transformer like stones as the "watchers". I would have shown the races that are to become us today too, you know, with Noah as Mongloid-ish, his wife white, the 3 wives of the 3 sons of color, I would have spent less time on meaningless soap opera drama and more time after the flood and how the couples spread, built and repopulated even if it were just narrated, or maybe the other way round, spend more time on what went on before the flood, like when the watchers married earth women and had children who became giants "Men of renown", and how they came to be so corrupt as to make God want to eliminate them. and what was with the snake skin rapped around the arm for, to pass down a blessing? In other Bible type texts it was told that after Adam and Eve were expelled they feared being killed by animals so God skinned a sheep and dressed them with it, that sheepskin was handed down from generations to Noah, it had magical powers that who ever owned it would become great and feared by animals, Ham steels it as he leaves the family and hands it down to his children (Nimrod the mighty hunter) later myths Jason and the Argonotts Golden Fleece,  I also would have made a better and more sophisticated ark. not a good movie

text: Okay, while most people are involved in the religion vs atheism debate, you miss the point that this story is a fable. The bible story might be true or false, but the movie is nothing but a story. And as far as stories go, it is a pretty. Impelling one, with moral dilemmas, psychological depth and good action. text: It seems like that the people of the comments don't understand the story of Noah and his Ark and the reason why God annihilated the human race or the simple reason of why religion exists in the another viewpoint. Just a disclaimer, I am not a hardcore catholic nor will I force my views upon you but simply tell you guys some things about Noah and things I've learned in my philosophy class.   At the time of Noah, the Earth was plagued by death, murder, and sin. God was disgusted at what his creation has become and in the trailer it said, "if man continued in his way the the creator will annihilate the world." God regretted his creation and decided to wipe them off the face of the Earth (God created us in His image, to be good, and to do good) but Noah found great favor in the eyes of the Lord. Noah was one who was "blameless among the people of his time, and he walked faithfully with God.-genesis 5:32-10:1) and Noah was found "righteous in this generation." That is why Noah and his family survived the terrible storm.  We are humans. We have our high and our lows. Some of us have hit rock bottom and some of us have gone as high as happiness could take us. But religion and God exists to us because we have experienced lows that the only thing to keep us going is the belief that an all knowing diety could help us in our time of need, we call it hope. When you hit rock bottom and no one could help you, who do you ask? You say the words a lot of people say, "God help me." The belief that God exists and that he helps out and does all these great and wonderful things resides in us as a person. If the world was perfect, people all had the same house, the same everything and everyone had what they need and had no problems especially with feelings then God wouldn't exist because if life was perfect and we never hit the low moments then we wouldn't need God. This can be seen in various written works, my favorite is Brave New World by Aldous Huxley who was an English writer and philosopher.

text: أنا تابعت الفيلم يوجد منها القليل ماصح ولكن أكثرها خرافات وتلاعب بالقصة  : أخطاء الفيلم كثيرة ومنها :  1- أن الله عاقب الملائكة الذين لم يحمو الجنة ودخل إليها ابليس واغوا آدم وحواء عليهم السلام حتى يأكلوا من الشجرة وأنزل الملائكة للدنيا على هيئة حجار ملعونه .. استغفر الله  2- أب نوح عليه السلام لديه قدرة عجيبه وأنه اشفى البنت التي عاشت مع نوح حتى تحمل !! وأنه عاش إلى حدوث الطوفان وغرق ؟ .. استغفر الله  3- زوجة نوح لم تؤمن بالله وغرقت بالطوفان ، والفيلم يقول العكس ركبة السفينة وأنها مؤمنه !!  4- لدى نوح عليه السلام أربعة أبناء ،ثلاثة منهم آمنوا وركبوا السفينة ، وواحد كفر ولم يؤمن وكان من المنافقين يظهر الإيمان ويبطن الكفر فغرق في الطوفان كما ذكر في القرآن الكريم .. والفيلم يقول لديه ثلاثة أبناء وفتاة ربوها عندهم !! وجمعيهم مؤمنين .. استغفر الله  5- قصة الفتاة في الفيلم خرافه ولم يرد عنها ، وأن نوح كان يريد قتل بنتيها في السفينة حتى لا تتكاثر البشرية .. كله هذا خزعبلات  6- سفينة نوح عليه السلام لا يدخلها إلا من أمن بالله والفيلم يقول العكس رجل عدو لنوح دخلها ونجى من الطوفان واتفق مع إبن نوح على الانتقام وقتل نوح ؟ ( كيف كافر يركب السفينة وينجى من الطوفان ) !! استغفر الله  7- نوح عليه السلام رسل لنشر الدعوة للإيمان بالله على البشرية لمدة 950 عام ولم يؤمن إلا القليل منهم وقيل 80 شخص ركبو معه للسفينة .. والفيلم يقول لم يركب معه إلا زوجته وابناءه وفتاة والحيوانات وعدو نوح فقط !! هل يعقل نبي يدعو للإيمان 950 عام ولم يؤمن به ؟ ولا ينجى من الطوفان ولا رجل ولا امرأة !! استغفر الله  8- الملائكة تحارب البشر مع نوح عليه السلام وماتت ثم عادت للجنة !! استغفر الله  9- إبن نوح وحبيبته يتعاشرون داخل السفينة وتحمل وتلد بطفلتين !! استغفر الله  10- أبناء نوح تحارب ابوهم داخل السفينة واحد من أجل الإنتقام لأنه لم ينقذ حبيبته !! والأخر يدافع عن زوجته وبنتيه حتى لا يقتلهم نوح !!  11- إبن نوح وحبيبته حاولوا الهرب من السفينة حتى انقاذ بناتهم !!   هذا اللي شفته وفيه كثير من الخرافات والكذب والبعض هنا يقول مشابه للقصة !!؟ استغفر الله﻿

text: Some verses of the Quran by our Prophet Noah, peace be upon him:  قَالُوا يَا نُوحُ قَدْ جَادَلْتَنَا فَأَكْثَرْتَ جِدَالَنَا فَأْتِنَا بِمَا تَعِدُنَا إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ They said, "O Noah, you have disputed us and been frequent in dispute of us. So bring us what you threaten us, if you should be of the truthful." 11:32   قَالَ إِنَّمَا يَأْتِيكُم بِهِ اللَّهُ إِن شَاءَ وَمَا أَنتُم بِمُعْجِزِينَ He said, " Allah will only bring it to you if He wills, and you will not cause [Him] failure. 11:33   وَأُوحِيَ إِلَىٰ نُوحٍ أَنَّهُ لَن يُؤْمِنَ مِن قَوْمِكَ إِلَّا مَن قَدْ آمَنَ فَلَا تَبْتَئِسْ بِمَا كَانُوا يَفْعَلُونَ And it was revealed to Noah that, "No one will believe from your people except those who have already believed, so do not be distressed by what they have been doing. 11:36   وَاصْنَعِ الْفُلْكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا وَوَحْيِنَا وَلَا تُخَاطِبْنِي فِي الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا ۚ إِنَّهُم مُّغْرَقُونَ And construct the ship under Our observation and Our inspiration and do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are [to be] drowned." 11:37   وَيَصْنَعُ الْفُلْكَ وَكُلَّمَا مَرَّ عَلَيْهِ مَلَأٌ مِّن قَوْمِهِ سَخِرُوا مِنْهُ ۚ قَالَ إِن تَسْخَرُوا مِنَّا فَإِنَّا نَسْخَرُ مِنكُمْ كَمَا تَسْخَرُونَ And he constructed the ship, and whenever an assembly of the eminent of his people passed by him, they ridiculed him. He said, "If you ridicule us, then we will ridicule you just as you ridicule. 11:38   حَتَّىٰ إِذَا جَاءَ أَمْرُنَا وَفَارَ التَّنُّورُ قُلْنَا احْمِلْ فِيهَا مِن كُلٍّ زَوْجَيْنِ اثْنَيْنِ وَأَهْلَكَ إِلَّا مَن سَبَقَ عَلَيْهِ الْقَوْلُ وَمَنْ آمَنَ ۚ وَمَا آمَنَ مَعَهُ إِلَّا قَلِيلٌ [So it was], until when Our command came and the oven overflowed, We said, "Load upon the ship of each [creature] two mates and your family, except those about whom the word has preceded, and [include] whoever has believed." But none had believed with him, except a few. 11:40   وَقَالَ ارْكَبُوا فِيهَا بِسْمِ اللَّهِ مَجْرَاهَا وَمُرْسَاهَا ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّي لَغَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ And [Noah] said, "Embark therein; in the name of Allah is its course and its anchorage. Indeed, my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful." 11:41   وَهِيَ تَجْرِي بِهِمْ فِي مَوْجٍ كَالْجِبَالِ وَنَادَىٰ نُوحٌ ابْنَهُ وَكَانَ فِي مَعْزِلٍ يَا بُنَيَّ ارْكَب مَّعَنَا وَلَا تَكُن مَّعَ الْكَافِرِينَ And it sailed with them through waves like mountains, and Noah called to his son who was apart [from them], "O my son, come aboard with us and be not with the disbelievers." 11:42   قَالَ سَآوِي إِلَىٰ جَبَلٍ يَعْصِمُنِي مِنَ الْمَاءِ ۚ قَالَ لَا عَاصِمَ الْيَوْمَ مِنْ أَمْرِ اللَّهِ إِلَّا مَن رَّحِمَ ۚ وَحَالَ بَيْنَهُمَا الْمَوْجُ فَكَانَ مِنَ الْمُغْرَقِينَ [But] he said, "I will take refuge on a mountain to protect me from the water." [Noah] said, "There is no protector today from the decree of Allah , except for whom He gives mercy." And the waves came between them, and he was among the drowned. 11:43   وَقِيلَ يَا أَرْضُ ابْلَعِي مَاءَكِ وَيَا سَمَاءُ أَقْلِعِي وَغِيضَ الْمَاءُ وَقُضِيَ الْأَمْرُ وَاسْتَوَتْ عَلَى الْجُودِيِّ ۖ وَقِيلَ بُعْدًا لِّلْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ And it was said, "O earth, swallow your water, and O sky, withhold [your rain]." And the water subsided, and the matter was accomplished, and the ship came to rest on the [mountain of] Judiyy. And it was said, "Away with the wrongdoing people." 11:44   وَنَادَىٰ نُوحٌ رَّبَّهُ فَقَالَ رَبِّ إِنَّ ابْنِي مِنْ أَهْلِي وَإِنَّ وَعْدَكَ الْحَقُّ وَأَنتَ أَحْكَمُ الْحَاكِمِينَ And Noah called to his Lord and said, "My Lord, indeed my son is of my family; and indeed, Your promise is true; and You are the most just of judges!" 11:45   قَالَ يَا نُوحُ إِنَّهُ لَيْسَ مِنْ أَهْلِكَ ۖ إِنَّهُ عَمَلٌ غَيْرُ صَالِحٍ ۖ فَلَا تَسْأَلْنِ مَا لَيْسَ لَكَ بِهِ عِلْمٌ ۖ إِنِّي أَعِظُكَ أَن تَكُونَ مِنَ الْجَاهِلِينَ He said, "O Noah, indeed he is not of your family; indeed, he is [one whose] work was other than righteous, so ask Me not for that about which you have no knowledge. Indeed, I advise you, lest you be among the ignorant." 11:46   قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ أَنْ أَسْأَلَكَ مَا لَيْسَ لِي بِهِ عِلْمٌ ۖ وَإِلَّا تَغْفِرْ لِي وَتَرْحَمْنِي أَكُن مِّنَ الْخَاسِرِينَ [Noah] said, "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from asking that of which I have no knowledge. And unless You forgive me and have mercy upon me, I will be among the losers." 11: 47   قِيلَ يَا نُوحُ اهْبِطْ بِسَلَامٍ مِّنَّا وَبَرَكَاتٍ عَلَيْكَ وَعَلَىٰ أُمَمٍ مِّمَّن مَّعَكَ ۚ وَأُمَمٌ سَنُمَتِّعُهُمْ ثُمَّ يَمَسُّهُم مِّنَّا عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ It was said, "O Noah, disembark in security from Us and blessings upon you and upon nations [descending] from those with you. But other nations [of them] We will grant enjoyment; then there will touch them from Us a painful punishment." 11:48   تِلْكَ مِنْ أَنبَاءِ الْغَيْبِ نُوحِيهَا إِلَيْكَ ۖ مَا كُنتَ تَعْلَمُهَا أَنتَ وَلَا قَوْمُكَ مِن قَبْلِ هَٰذَا ۖ فَاصْبِرْ ۖ إِنَّ الْعَاقِبَةَ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muhammad]. You knew it not, neither you nor your people, before this. So be patient; indeed, the [best] outcome is for the righteous . 11:49   There's more on the story of Prophet Noah in the Quran in many parts.

text: I watched this film with my sister two days ago and we both found it really boring. Its over two hours long. The producers have really distorted the biblical story of Noah in the bible. text: ....Gathering people who wants to be a part of building a network of stable, fully self sustaining and self sufficient communities (a.k.a. life-boats for the coming environmental collapse).  Communities that live and thrive in harmony and with responsibility.  Peaceful communities that are built upon foundation of : love, spirituality, mercy, generosity, tolerance, intelligent, and wisdom. If you are interested in becoming a part of this grass root efforts, We encourage your reply.  This Community ARK Project is looking for peaceful, patience, humble, and kind-hearted people who are awaken and aware of the coming environmental collapse; who want to roll up their sleeves and participate in preparatory efforts. One cannot pull someone out of a raging river standing on a muddy slippery slope. In order to pull someone out of the river, one must stand on a firm solid foundation. A fully self-sufficient community is that solid foundation, upon which we stand in order to rescue other less fortunate who will be affected by the collapsing environment.  If people are struggling to survive as the environment collapses, how can they help others?  People need fully self-sufficient communities to shelter and nourish them, in order for them to reach out and help others.  We are gathering people from all spectrum of professional background: engineers, scientists, architects, biologists, farmers, doctors, nurses, artists, etc. Both skilled and unskilled people. Those with knowledge will teach those who lack them. Those not in the know will listen and learn so they might in turn teach others in the community. We have spent 6 years researching technology that were designed to allow Mars colonies to thrive in a desolate environment. We are now planning on using those very same technology to prepare people for the coming environmental collapse. If you are interested in helping out, we could use the help to reach the ears of people who are awaken through social media, or you can read our blog titled "Generalized Plan of Actions" for a list of tasks you can volunteer for.  (Note: this is a gathering process and NOT a recruitment process. When one recruit, one is trying to convince others to join a cause; well, someone else can always come along and convince people to join a different cause. But when one gather, one is speaking to those of like mind who do not need convincing; in their hearts and in their thoughts, they recognize the catastrophe that lay ahead if our modern societies continue on their current path of promoting competition, strife, ignorance and scarcity. This Community ARK Project is lighting a beacon so that those with similar mind set will know that they are not alone in their thoughts and impulses; that there are others like them out there who desire to come together to pool our effort in order to EXTRACT ourselves and place ourselves on a different path.  One that promote cooperation, harmony, foresight, and a nurturing environment.)
author: Community ARK Project

text: Noah 2: Balls of Fire It is the year 2803AD and the Creator communicates with Noah stating he will now scorch the Earth for it's sin and decadence. Noah and his family are monitored from around the world, they are mocked and scorned by the denizens of Eurabia, the Trinity States of Americas and the Christian Confederated Asia. (So it was) till then there came Our Command and the oven gushed forth (water like fountains from the earth). Surely, my Lord is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.  42. So it (the ship) sailed with them amidst the waves like mountains, and Nuh (Noah) called out to his son, who had separated himself (apart), "O my son! Embark with us and be not with the disbelievers."  43. The son replied: "I will betake myself to a mountain, it will save me from the water." Nuh (Noah) said: "This day there is no saviour from the Decree of Allah except him on whom He has mercy." And a wave came in between them, so he (the son) was among the drowned.  44. And it was said: "O earth! Swallow up your water, and O sky! Withhold (your rain)." And the water was diminished (made to subside) and the Decree (of Allah) was fulfilled (i.e. the destruction of the people of Nuh (Noah). And it (the ship) rested on Mount Judi, and it was said: "Away with the people who are Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doing)!"  45. And Nuh (Noah) called upon his Lord and said, "O my Lord! text: So when Hollywood is out of ideas, they start making fictions from fictions itself. The one thing that stupefied me from that Biblical Noah story was this: Ham disrespected his father Noah when Noah was asleep but Noah punished Ham son, Canaan, instead of Ham. Huh? Does that even make sense? It is either Noah, on waking up, was still dizzy from the wine that crashed him or Noah was a straight up moron. In my estimation, if I must take that biblical Noah story as facts of history, Ham son, Canaan was cursed because Canaan was the produce of a sexual encounter that happened between Ham and Ham's mother (Yes Noah wife). We understand through research that seeing a man nakedness as referred to by many ancient culture (and even some cultures in todays world) is mating with the man's wife. Except Ham sodomised his father and this is unlikely because it makes absolutely no sense to purnish a grand son that is not directly or indirectly connected to his father misdeed. And the Bible saying Canaan was punished by his grand father because his father simply only just saw his grand father sleeping naked is just too illogical. That part of the Bible like many other Bible parts just make the Bible a straight up fiction book. And the Bible having all these nonsensical stories just means two things. It is either the Bible like other religious books are a fabrication of history or the Bible and other religious books stories somewhere in history was altered. I like to accept the latter because I never found a story discussed in the Bible, Quran, and Torah that is 100% similar in description.

text: This film and the biblical narrative distorts the image of prophet Noah so much it is heart wrenching. The prophets of Allah are the best role models for mankind, the best husbands, the best fathers, the best members of their community and at large the entire earth. He was one of the 'ulul atham' one of five prophets known to have great determination. And great determination indeed, he had to be patient with his people for 900 years. Who can preach for an hour let alone 900 years for the benefit of his people? The flood was the response of his prayer when no one would believe. His son was separated by a wave and drowned as he chose not to board the ark, he did not believe in the message of his father. Neither did the wife of Noah and she is also mentioned as a disbeliever despite having the best husband. He wasn't commanded to kill his granddaughter, and he was a great human being, we are all of his progeny and as a result of his efforts. May peace be upon Noah (as) and all the prophets ameen. Despite this the trailer is worth viewing to remind us of this epic tale, and the graphics bring it to life as well as remind us what will happen on the day judgement.

text: This movie is the director's and writer's view of the story of Noah. Whether one believes in it or not, Noah's story has been remembered and accepted by various cultures and religions, from the Ancient Near East to  Mesopotamia to the Hebrews to the ancient Greeks etc. Maybe the story is related to floods that took place in Mesopotamia around theTigris and Euphrates rivers or some other body of water in the eastern Mediterranean region.  The man called Noah was a great man who lived long ago and did extraordinary things and was remembered and revered later on by most people and religions, his story being told in different ways but with common features. So there is most likely an original layer of historical truth behind this story.

text: Daniel 7 New Revised Standard Version (NRSV) Visions of the Four Beasts 7 In the first year of King Belshazzar of Babylon, Daniel had a dream and visions of his head as he lay in bed. Then he wrote down the dream:[a] 2 I,[b] Daniel, saw in my vision by night the four winds of heaven stirring up the great sea, 3 and four great beasts came up out of the sea, different from one another. 4 The first was like a lion and had eagles’ wings. Then, as I watched, its wings were plucked off, and it was lifted up from the ground and made to stand on two feet like a human being; and a human mind was given to it. 5 Another beast appeared, a second one, that looked like a bear. It was raised up on one side, had three tusks[c] in its mouth among its teeth and was told, “Arise, devour many bodies!” 6 After this, as I watched, another appeared, like a leopard. The beast had four wings of a bird on its back and four heads; and dominion was given to it. 7 After this I saw in the visions by night a fourth beast, terrifying and dreadful and exceedingly strong. It had great iron teeth and was devouring, breaking in pieces, and stamping what was left with its feet. It was different from all the beasts that preceded it, and it had ten horns. 8 I was considering the horns, when another horn appeared, a little one coming up among them; to make room for it, three of the earlier horns were plucked up by the roots. There were eyes like human eyes in this horn, and a mouth speaking arrogantly.  Judgment before the Ancient One 9 As I watched, thrones were set in place,     and an Ancient One[d] took his throne, his clothing was white as snow,     and the hair of his head like pure wool; his throne was fiery flames,     and its wheels were burning fire. 10 A stream of fire issued     and flowed out from his presence. A thousand thousands served him,     and ten thousand times ten thousand stood attending him. The court sat in judgment,     and the books were opened.  11 I watched then because of the noise of the arrogant words that the horn was speaking. And as I watched, the beast was put to death, and its body destroyed and given over to be burned with fire. 12 As for the rest of the beasts, their dominion was taken away, but their lives were prolonged for a season and a time. 13 As I watched in the night visions,  I saw one like a human being[e]     coming with the clouds of heaven. And he came to the Ancient One[f]     and was presented before him. 14 To him was given dominion     and glory and kingship, that all peoples, nations, and languages     should serve him. His dominion is an everlasting dominion     that shall not pass away, and his kingship is one     that shall never be destroyed.  Daniel’s Visions Interpreted 15 As for me, Daniel, my spirit was troubled within me,[g] and the visions of my head terrified me. 16 I approached one of the attendants to ask him the truth concerning all this. So he said that he would disclose to me the interpretation of the matter: 17 “As for these four great beasts, four kings shall arise out of the earth. 18 But the holy ones of the Most High shall receive the kingdom and possess the kingdom forever—forever and ever.”  19 Then I desired to know the truth concerning the fourth beast, which was different from all the rest, exceedingly terrifying, with its teeth of iron and claws of bronze, and which devoured and broke in pieces, and stamped what was left with its feet; 20 and concerning the ten horns that were on its head, and concerning the other horn, which came up and to make room for which three of them fell out—the horn that had eyes and a mouth that spoke arrogantly, and that seemed greater than the others. 21 As I looked, this horn made war with the holy ones and was prevailing over them, 22 until the Ancient One[h] came; then judgment was given for the holy ones of the Most High, and the time arrived when the holy ones gained possession of the kingdom.  23 This is what he said: “As for the fourth beast,  there shall be a fourth kingdom on earth     that shall be different from all the other kingdoms; it shall devour the whole earth,     and trample it down, and break it to pieces. 24 As for the ten horns, out of this kingdom ten kings shall arise,     and another shall arise after them. This one shall be different from the former ones,     and shall put down three kings. 25 He shall speak words against the Most High,     shall wear out the holy ones of the Most High,     and shall attempt to change the sacred seasons and the law; and they shall be given into his power     for a time, two times,[i] and half a time. 26 Then the court shall sit in judgment,     and his dominion shall be taken away,     to be consumed and totally destroyed. 27 The kingship and dominion     and the greatness of the kingdoms under the whole heaven     shall be given to the people of the holy ones of the Most High; their kingdom shall be an everlasting kingdom,     and all dominions shall serve and obey them.”  28 Here the account ends. As for me, Daniel, my thoughts greatly terrified me, and my face turned pale; but I kept the matter in my mind.

The symbol can be observed all throughout Antiquity, even in the midst of the Temple of Solomon. More recently, it can be seen within the High degrees of Freemasonry.
